results.description:
Tablao Sevilla
(Sept 9 & Sept 13) will recreate the “tablaos” café setting found in the traditional tablaos of Spain. All the emotion,drama and passion of traditional flamenco will be experience in this tribute to the art form. Effervescent heel-and-toe step combinations and volcanic shoulder and hip actions will present flamenco in its most pure and improvised form. Por Los Caminos
(Sept 11 & Sept 12) will feature flamenco in a traditional theater setting,displaying rage,lament,joy and serenity in a rhythmic work of feeling and passion. The choreography will reflect the blending of cultures that comprise the art of flamenco, illustrating the influence of Latin American, Middle Eastern and other dance forms on the medium. SAVE THE DATES!

During this interactive event, we will outline the ideal Co-Founder relationship, and teach you how to construct Co-Founder agreements, split equity, manage responsibilities, and deal with conflicts. 

This webinar will feature two successful serial entrepreneurs: Adeo Ressi (Founder and CEO of the Founder Institute, 9X entrepreneur, and Managing Director of Expansive Ventures), and Jessica Alter (Founder and CEO of FounderDating and Formative Labs). 

Discussion topics include: 

- How to set up a collaborative working relationship with your cofounder 

- How to split tasks through division of responsibilities 

- How to structure a cofounder agreement 

- How to divide equity among cofounders 

- How to handle challenges and conflicts

results.description:
Hi Newark Social Family,

First and foremost, a BIG “Thank You” to everyone who has contributed their time, effort, and feedback to the meetup.com experience. I have learned that one cannot have enough great company filled with heartfelt stories, positive energy, and shared laughter. Not only have I met and befriended wonderful people, but have bridged people to people as well. Without you, this could not have happened so again…Thank you!

On a different note, for those that are uncertain, the purpose of the “Roll Call” is to reconfirm who is attending an event. Trust, I have had 20 RSVP’s for an event and ZERO show-ups. Your time as well as my time is a precious commodity and should not be wasted.  Roll Calls are posted at least 24 hours prior to event time.  If no one reconfirms, hence, I cancel.

Last but not least, I want everyone to enjoy themselves so your input is greatly appreciated. Events are not limited to the city of Newark only. If you see something already on meetup and it should be shared, then send me the link. After I read them, I will plan accordingly and set things up. Hear from you soon. B.

**Note**

This post is NOT an actual meetup, but to serve as a brainchild for ideas so let us all get to cooking!!!

results.description:
Directiosn From NY Route 9D, look for Bob's Corner Store in Beacon. Turn east onto Howland Avenue. then immediately turn right into the parking area for Scenic Hudson's Mount Beacon Park.

Public Transportation: Metro-North Hudson Line to Beacon station -- walk uphill to trailhead

Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding lookout point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson River and surrounding area.

Distance: 4 miles round trip
The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain. Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit. On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).
You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.
If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.
results.name: Mt. Beacon ~ Fire Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE ~

results.description:
Positive Connections for Success is a more relaxed and personal networking group for business professionals looking to build relationships and grow their business through referrals.

We focus on:

• Networking: Building relationships and earning each others trust to become referral partners

• Education: Understanding your business and helping you articulate your business

• Leadership: Leaders of the round table philosophy, every member is a leader of this group


We follow a structured meeting agenda starting with networking to develop relationships, giving us time to talk and get to know each other while having a warm breakfast, followed by:

• One Minute Elevator Pitch

• Business Presentations with Q&A and feedback (we have a large screen & clicker/pointer available for powerpoint presentations)

• Brainstorming Session, Successes & Referrals to Help Each Others Businesses grow

• Lots of Fun in the Process

"We Refer Business Partners, Not Business Cards!"

This is a group with category/specialty specific members (only one member per category/speciality).
Please view our sponsors page or contact us to verify your industry, category and specialty, before attending a meeting so as to not be in conflict with a group member.

We meet every Thursday morning from 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM and welcome guests to come and experience the group and then apply to join.

Non-members/guests pay a $10 fee to attend, which includes a warm served breakfast of their choosing and we ask to please be prepared with a one minute elevator pitch presenting:

• who you are

• type of business

• who would be a good referral for you


Current positions that we are interviewing, to build relationships with and pass referrals to include:

• Auto Mechanic

• Cleaning Service

• Florist

• Handyman or women

• Landscaper

• Limo or car service

• Painter

• Plumber

• And more...

Please contact us for information or if you have any questions.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meetup!
results.how_to_find_us: It's 7am, you'll see us!

results.description:
at Prodigy on Carmine Street
8am-9am

What is coffee chat?

#CoffeeChat is a time for us to meet while we're on your way to work in the morning or just about to get your day started. We come together for about an hour to share stories and find some common conversation with other people who are working to make positive things happen.

Over the years of attending #CoffeeChat events, we see that people have continued to come together; it's a little bit of networking and a little bit of inspiration. I hope wherever you are you will consider organizing your own morning meetup with like-minded (or different-minded!) people in your community.

When you raise the flag, and let people know what you are interested in (especially if that interest involves bringing like minded people together) you are well on your way to making a positive difference and a significant impact on your local community.

And, if you do schedule a coffee chat, please do let us know; we'll post the event here! I look forward to getting to spend more time with you and the community you surround yourself.

Jason

PS: (the hashtag is how we promote on Instagram, Twitter, etc: #CoffeeChat)

results.description:
DESCRIPTION

Data science offers new ways of looking at the world. At Columbia University and elsewhere, researchers are mining massive data sets to investigate the origins of our universe, the effects of climate change on our oceans and the structure of promising nanoscale materials. With support of the Moore and Sloan foundations, this work is part of a broader effort to bring the latest machine learning and statistical techniques to traditional scientific analysis. Researchers from Columbia, NYU, the University of Missouri and the NASA Goddard Institute for Space Studies will discuss how data science is enabling discovery in their fields.  [CLICK HERE FOR FULL AGENDA]


KEYNOTE SPEAKERS:

• David W. Hogg | Professor of Physics and Data Science, NYU

• Gavin A. Schmidt | Director of NASA Goddard Institute for Space Studies

FEATURED SPEAKERS:


• Christopher K. Wikle | Professor of Statistics, University of Missouri

• M. Benno Blumenthal | Data Library Manager, International Research Institute for Climate and Society, Columbia University

• Carlos Fernandez-Granda | Assistant Professor of Mathematics, NYU

PANEL MODERATOR:

• Joshua M. Greenberg | Director of Digital Information Technology, Alfred P. Sloan Foundation

NATURAL SCIENCES AND DATA SCIENCES CLUSTERS AT COLUMBIA:

The Birth of the Universe and the Fate of the Earth: 1012 UV Photons Meet Stan

• David Schiminovich | Associate Professor of Astronomy, Columbia University

• Andrew Gelman | Professor of Statistics and Political Science, Columbia University

Mining an Ocean of Data: Application of Modern Statistical Methods for Addressing Biological Oceanography Questions


• Joaquim Goes | Lamont Research Professor, Columbia University

• Rahul Mazumder | Assistant Professor of Operations Research and Statistics, MIT

High Dimensional Data Analysis of Microscopy Images


• Abhay Narayan | Associate Professor of Physics, Columbia University

• John Wright | Assistant Professor of Electrical Engineering, Columbia University

Listening to the Arctic Fauna (Recipient of Data Science Interdisciplinary ROADS Grant)


• Natalie Boelman | Lamont Associate Research Professor in the Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory

Daniel Ellis | Professor of Electrical Engineering, Columbia University

FULL AGENDA AND DETAILS

* LUNCH: The will be a light fare available during the lunch break, however brown bag lunch is encouraged.

Space Limited; 1st Come, 1st Seated. Live webcasting available.


LOCATION

Davis Auditorium, Room 412, 4th Floor/Campus Level
The Schapiro Center for Engineering and Physical Science Research (Schapiro CEPSR), 530 West 120th Street (between Broadway and Amsterdam)

ABOUT

This event is funded in part by the Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation through Grant GBMF3941 to Columbia University and the Alfred P. Sloan Foundation.

DISABILITY ACCOMMODATIONS

Columbia University makes every effort to accommodate individuals with disabilities. If you require disability-related accommodations to attend this event, please contact Disability Services at[masked] or [masked] at least 5 business days in advance of the event.

Davis Auditorium is accessible via the upper campus level entrance to Schapiro/CEPSR or via the 120th Street entrance to campus. If you have any questions about campus accessibility, please contact Sarah Mitchell-Weed, Compliance Manager for Access and Accommodations at [masked] or at[masked]

Morningside Accessibility Map: http://www.columbia.edu/files/columbia/content/accessibilitymap2014.pdf
results.name: Workshop: Unlocking the Mysteries of the Physical World with Data Science

results.description:
I have been volunteering with Diane at Saint Marks Episcopal Church Community Outreach Center where they serve breakfast and lunch every day to people in need and also distribute food to them. On the second Thursday of each month they get a large shipment from the USDA/SFPP that needs to be unloaded, sorted and then distributed to the people when they come. The unloading and sorting takes place from 9am to 1pm and then from 1- 6pm they need people to walk a family through to select their items to take home to re-stock their pantries. I plan to go at 9am and will stay as long as I can.


You can come any time during this 9am-6pm  time frame and stay at little or as long as you can, they will appreciate any amount of time that you give. They also will appreciate if you bring any grocery bags for the people to use to carry things home. Please call the center if you have further questions[masked] and like their facebook page for updates too:

https://www.facebook.com/SaintMarksKeansburg

Come out and make a difference!    Hope to see YOU there! 


Love, Cassie
results.how_to_find_us: the center is the tan building next to the church
results.name: Volunteers Needed for USDA Pantry Day

results.description:
Did you know that no matter what else your company does, it's always in the cash business?

For start-ups (or those already in business), this workshop will help you understand and manage your cash resources. You will discuss important questions with an experienced business lender and financial manager. You will leave better equipped to manage your company's finances. You will get answers to these questions: What is "Funding"?

• How much money will I need to reach breakeven or to achieve my financial goals?

• Do I need new money, why, and what forms will be most appropriate?

• What are the trade-offs among various funding alternatives?

• What is "Leverage"? What are the risks to me and to the funder?

• How do I find a funder? Where do I start looking? When?

• If I can find a funder, what will be the terms & conditions?

• What will the funder need to learn to make a decision?

• Does my credit score matter?

• What is the real cost of new money to my business?

Who should attend this workshop:

If you plan to start a business or if you have questions about cash needs to grow your business or to solve many common business problems.

Join us and participate in a valuable and thought provoking, interactive session leading to a follow-up discussion, at your option, with a SCORE NYC Mentor.

Instructors

Harry Precourt

Harry Precourt has several decades’ experience keeping companies solvent, structuring financing to solve cash-flow issues and sustain growth. His success in the for-profit sector as a senior lending officer with major banks, a principal with a major accounting firm and CEO/founder/owner of a corporate finance advisory firm uniquely qualifies him on the area of finance. He has applied this experience and techniques to the nonprofit sector as board member, acting CFO, and member of executive management positions. Harry is a SCORE NYC Mentor.

Sharon Harris

Sharon Harris has decades of experience in credit and lending with bank and non-bank lenders. She was a senior executive in lending and credit with JPMorgan Chase for over 30 years. She has worked in a senior lending capacity with GE Capital and with small and midsize lenders in credit and loan restructuring roles. Sharon is a SCORE NYC Mentor.

Workshop Fees

Online registration $59, walk-ins $69
There is a $10 discount on all Student and SEAP registrations
(valid ID must be presented at the door).

Register : http://events.r20.constantcontact.com/register/event?oeidk=a07eb592fcca64bde42&llr=7bofavbab
results.name: Funding Your Small Business

results.description:
NOOBIES AND NEWARK RESIDENTS SEE IF YOUR ELIGIBLE • SEP. 10TH

The City of Newark, the Newark Workforce Investment Board, and Newark Works have partnered with New Jersey Institute of Technology to provide a FREE Training Program in Web Development – The Art of Code.  This program curriculum will teach the most important aspects of software engineering and web development, and will help aspiring junior-level developers gain employment.  We believe Newark, NJ is the perfect training ground to prepare a talented labor force from under-represented backgrounds for careers in the technology sector.

The objective of this project is to assist in the technical training of unemployed and underemployed Newark residents with a focus on modern web development.  Students will learn the fundamentals of full-stack web development using the JavaScript programming language and several popular open source JavaScript frameworks.  In addition students will learn about modern software development techniques including agile web development and the use of version control and build tools to build scalable software.

Job Placement services will be provided, and students will also participate in classes designed to support their job search.  This will cover interview preparation, succeeding in written and oral exams, and mock interviews. 

PRESIGN UP AT THEARTOFCODE.ORG

*MUST BE A NEWARK RESIDENT

results.description:
Think of how much happier you would be, not to mention how much more productive you would be, if you eliminated excuses. How about, how much more could you earn??


Unfortunately the number of people who choose to make excuses rather than take action is tremendous. Success requires action and a strong work ethic - not a passive attitude.

You don't have to know HOW it's going to happen, you just have to KNOW it's going to happen!

THE 7 THINGS EVERY SMALL BUSINESS OWNER


NEEDS TO KNOW TO EARN MORE IN 2015!

There's a big difference between goal setting and goal achieving. Learn how to set and achieve any goal you </a>truly desire. If you're ready to stop wishing and start living the life you believe you deserve, it's time to participate in our Goal Achiever Success System to Earn More in 2015

You'll learn to:
• Use a systematic approach (Your Process) to decide what you really want, and choose your goal accordingly.
• Recognize the goals you don't want, and remove them from your focus.
• Develop and utilize the attitude and energy that attracts the support and assistance you need to achieve your goals.
• Prioritize your goal list, whether it includes 5 goals or 5,000.
• Decide what your #1 goal is.

Where: C3Workplace Montclair
26 Park Street, Montclair, NJ 07042

When: Thursday, September 10th - 11:30am-1:30pm

Fee: $45 (includes lunch)

SEATING IS VERY LIMITED

GET TO KNOW OUR PANELISTS:

Tommy Hilcken

<a href="http://www.c3workplace.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/0c76227.jpg">

As master storyteller and dynamic entertaining speaker, Tommy has been educating and inspiring audiences around the world for over 25 years. Tommy’s innovative LAUGH & LEARN style uses humor and storytelling to teach powerful, positive, and impactful messages that audiences remember.

Donna Miller

As a business and community leader, a speaker, an educator, and an entrepreneur, Donna is passionate about seeing small businesses thrive. She has helped to start and grow well over 1,200 businesses in the last 20+ years. Donna believes in the power of collaboration and designed both the business and facilities to provide opportunities for entrepreneurs to connect, collaborate, and to grow their business community.

To Register CLICK HERE!

results.description:
The streets of Lower Manhattan are alive in history and in daily activity. What began as a small trading outpost has grown to house institutions like the New York Stock Exchange and the World Trade Center. On this tour you experience the most historical site in all of the United States and others of immeasurable historical significance. The information presented will unveil new realities and perceptions that typically lay unseen.

Itinerary:
• Alexander Hamilton U.S Customs House
• Wall Street Bull
• Trinity Church
• New York Stock Exchange
• Federal Hall
• World Trade Center
• St. Paul’s Chapel
• And Much More

Reservations:
Please RSVP. If you later realize you will not be able to attend please change your reservation.

Where:

Participants meet with the guide ten minutes before tour begins in front of the National Museum of the American Indian at 1 Bowling Green) map here. Tour concludes at City Hall Park map here.

Cost:
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You are not charged. At the end of the tour you can put a value to the information presented in the form of a gratuity.

Some of the Sights we will experience:

results.description:
Deutsches Haus at NYU is presenting itself to the public at their annual Haus-Fest at 42 Washington Mews (on Univerity Pl betw E 8th St & Washington Sq Park). You can walk in between 04:30pm & 7:30pm this coming Thursday.

Note: This event overlaps with Beowulf's event at  the German Consulate that day, so you need to pick one or the other. Sorry guys, can't have everything ;)

What to expect:

This is not our regular monthly get-together. This is an opportunity to get to know Deutsches Haus and see what they do.


Throughout the event they have different kind of activities, here are a few of them:

04:30 Puppet Show for kids

05:00 - 06:30 Information Booths by the Consulate Generals of Austria, Switzerland, & Germany

05:30 - 06:30 Wine Tasting

06:30 - 06:45 Children's Choir Performance

06:45 - 07:30 Live Concert w/ Tine Kindermann & Band (in the courtyard)

You can also test your level of proficiency in the German language at this event, or sign up for future Language classes.


To see their full schedule, please click the following link:

http://deutscheshaus.as.nyu.edu/object/io_1438804252118.html

This event will be interesting for people who are curious about the German language & culture, people who would like to find out what Deutsches Haus is, and people looking for information about Germany, Austria, & Switzerland. Kids & Families are welcome, this event is NOT exclusive to our group.

Please RSVP if you are planning to attend so I can gauge the level of interest on our group for this type of event and let the hosts of the event know what to expect.


In the meantime, please enjoy your labor day weekend everyone!

Thomas

[masked]


[masked]

results.description:
http://nyspin201509.eventbrite.com/?aff=mu

By attending the presentation of “12 Questions”, participants will understand how to embrace an effective strategy for achieving and sustaining behavioral change in their organization that leads to a culture of operational greatness. Drawing upon decades of experience as a world-class musician-turned-successful software engineering entrepreneur, presenter Jeff Dalton helps organizations understand what it takes to strengthen their agile approach so that it can scale companywide. Participants will take away tips for improving performance, predictability, collaboration and quality with agile values, methods and techniques, including how to:

-Bring greater clarity and strength to Scrum ceremonies

-Drive quality and performance improvement across the board

-Strengthen the understanding, adoption, and continuous improvement of the agile values and behaviors in your organization

-Reassure clients that you have a plan for scaling agile in a way that can help them get improved results

-Get more out of your investment in agile and other performance improvement frameworks

Brief Bio

Jeff Dalton is Broadsword’s President, Certified Lead Appraiser, CMMI Instructor, ScrumMaster and author of “agileCMMI", Broadsword’s leading methodology for incremental and iterative process improvement.  He is the former Chairman of the CMMI Institute’s Partner Advisory Board and President of the Great Lakes Software Process Improvement Network (GL-SPIN). Jeff was the Keynote Speaker for the PMI Great Lakes 2013 Symposium. In 2008, Jeff coined the term Process Debt to describe the crushing, over-bearing processes too many companies employ to achieve a CMMI rating. He is a recipient of the prestigious Software Engineering Institute’s SEI Member Award for Outstanding Representative for his work uniting the Agile and CMMI communities together through his popular blog “Ask the CMMI Appraiser”. 

Jeff holds degrees in Music and Computer Science and builds experimental airplanes in his spare time.

results.description:
Previously on The As Yet Unnamed Campaign of Increasingly Poor Decisions...

Our new characters live up to the campaign title and almost immediately get arrested.  Sloven, a drow on a mission to discover how much of other people's stuff can fit in his pockets, had the misfortune of being caught cheating at dice in the presence of Bruce, a troll in the Watch's employ.  He learned just how long the long arm of the law was when it bashed him in the head.  Twice.

Jerkenit, a Tiefling carny cleric with a wicked streak, got in hot water when his buxom bimbo sidekick Netalia was caught cutting purses by the Watch's newest members, the rest of the party.  A few well placed spells and Netalia was in custody, and Jerkenit was being brought in for questioning.

Meanwhile, the Dragonborn Karn, a sorcerer fresh off the boat from distant Prataro across the sea, comes seeking the aid of the Amtaris Mage's Guild for help in recovering his kingdom's crown jewels.  Unable to secure an immediate audience with any of the mages, he was directed towards temporary employment in the Watch while he waited for an answer.

At the Watch House, Sloven and Jerkenit were shanghaied into becoming entertainers for the Saj Estate's grand party, with Netalia and Sloven's truly impressive knife collection held as collateral towards their good behavior.  With the Saj Estate down two guards due to death by explosion, Karn showed up just in time to join the Watch and be attached to this merry band of lunatics.

At the Saj Estate, the brothers Aurora were approached by Count Stoe, a wealthy man who had heard of their work for Major Brightblade the previous evening.  He's got a son, Sebathian, in the slums that he wants quietly brought back into the fold, and after some tense negotiations, the brothers agreed to kidnapping/rescuing the boy.  At the end of their shift, they rounded up the posse and headed to the Banshee's Moan tavern in the slums.

On the way, the group was approached by the Aurora brother's devout, if misguided, convert Tim who asked them to take his son Tim Jr on an adventure to "do some good."  Despite a great deal of hesitation, the boy's earnestness won them over and they agreed to take him along for the time being.

At the Banshee's Moan, our upstanding members of the Watch sent their criminal compatriots into the tavern to blend in and do some recon.  After several hours of talking with customers, threatening the owner, and a truly impressive (if ultimately unsuccessful) attempt to catfish a barmaid, Sloven and Jerkenit escaped the bar right before the clientele were about to murder them.  They had discovered, however, that Sebathian was hanging out with a redheaded barmaid named Lyra until they both disappeared several days ago and the blonde barmaid working that night, Alessa, may know where Lyra went.

In an impressively poor decision, the party decided the best way to get Alessa to talk to them was to jump the pretty young girl after her shift and corner her in a dark alley.  Their plan was short lived however, when Alessa exited with several other members of the staff.  The party approached the barmaid and her friends in a tense attempt to parlay, but she clammed up at the sight of Watch badges.


Jerkenit, fed up with getting nowhere, threatened to kill the girl if she didn't tell them where Lyra was.  And that's when weapons got drawn.

Will the party fair better against the Banshee's Moan kitchen staff than they did against a flock of murderbirds?  Will they find Lyra and Sebathian?  Can they continue to uphold the Watch's oath to not kill anybody?  Will they manage to make even poorer decisions?


We find out this week, as we start in media res with a back alley brawl.

(And in other news, Duurg spent his time using his City Watch badge to beat up and arrest people, some of whom may have actually deserve it.)
results.name: The As Yet Unnamed Campaign of Increasingly Poor Decisions

results.description:
Join DM Kyle Wagenblast as he recreates the classic D&D 2E module "Adam's Wrath" by Lisa Smedman. This is an adventure in the Ravenloft setting, updated to D&D 5E, and is for characters of 5th level.

In the domain of Lamordia, Doctor Victor Mordenheim created Adam, cobbling the creature together from parts of human corpses. Now, years later, Adam wants revenge. Adam wants Elise, Victor's wife. Adam wants Victor dead.

The players' ship founders on the coast of the domain of Lamordia. A vicious storm leaves them washed ashore, cold and hungry on the ice-bound Isle of Agony... then, the terror begins.

results.description:
Agenda:


Fireside chat Patrick Heim - Head of Trust & Security at 

Dropbox 

Patrick manages security and compliance for both the company and its service. Patrick joined Dropbox in January 2015 with over 20 years of information security and technology experience. 

Previously, he served as Chief Trust Officer at Salesforce.com, where he built and ran a world class security team that contributed to making Salesforce one of the most trusted enterprise cloud vendors.  

Patrick also held Chief Information Security Officer positions at Kaiser Permanente and McKesson Corporation, and senior positions at Ernst & Young and two early stage security technology companies. 

Patrick advises security startups and serves on the board of directors at Cylance. 

Socure 


Title: Next-Gen Identity Verification: Facial Recognition with Social Biometrics™


Abstract: Fraudsters have grown more innovative; online and social media data may hold the key to better identity verification.  Based on decades of research and experience in security authentication and authorization, Sunil Madhu will discuss the recent advances in leveraging social media and trusted on-line data sources for identity verification.  Blending facial recognition with machine learning, new frictionless authentication enables the next generation of security – based on Social Biometrics. 

Sunil will unveil a new solution to this well-understood problem, one that overcomes the challenges that typically encumber the utility of facial recognition.


Presenter: Sunil Madhu, CEO and Co-Founder, Socure


Presenter Bio: Sunil is the founder and CEO of Socure, the leader in real-time online identity verification solutions, a start-up company based in New York City. Sunil is a serial entrepreneur, with several successful transitions through IPO and acquisition. A security architect by profession, he has spent over 20 years innovating identity and access management, addressing hard problems in network and application authentication and authorization.  At Socure, Sunil leads an experienced team who is ‘pushing the envelope’ of identity verification, by employing online and social media data for real-time consumer and business authentication. Sunil holds a MS degree in MIS from Glasgow Caledonian University and a BS with Honors in Computer Science from Strathclyde University in the UK.

Bob Gilbert, Chief Evangelist at Netskope. Bob heads up the product marketing and evangelism efforts at Netskope, the leader in safe cloud enablement. 

Bob is a prolific speaker and product demonstrator, reaching live audiences in more than 45 countries over the past decade. His career spans more than 20 years in Silicon Valley where he has held product management and marketing leadership roles at various technology companies. Most recently he was the Chief Evangelist at Riverbed where he was a member of the pioneering team that launched Riverbed from a small start-up of less than 10 employees to a market leader with more than 2,800 employees and $1B in annual revenue.

</a>

Cloud Security 2.0: Taking an app, user, and data-centric approach.

The Saas market is exploding with an average of 715 cloud apps in use per enterprise. While increased cloud usage is generally a good thing for productivity, using the cloud can increase the probability of a major data breach by up to 3 times. Previous generation cloud security technologies were built to address a narrow set of use cases and often leave an enterprise vulnerable to the risks that come with using the cloud. Bob Gilbert, Netskope's Chief Evangelist, will discuss the essential requirements for a comprehensive cloud security strategy and introduce next-generation technology that takes an app-, user-, data-centric approach to safely enabling the cloud. 

<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/tomermagid">Tomer Magid   |   GM & VP Product FireLayers Inc.

Tomer heads up FireLayers’ US operation and drives our product development organization. Under his leadership, our vision for delivering the industry’s policy-based, prevention-focused cloud application security solution has become a reality.
results.name: September NY Information Security Meetup

Hi All

Still solo on the road but should be barreling through Appalachia late Tuesday night with NYC in my cross hairs. So worry not the Hop is on! I might make changes to the gallery list so check back. See you Thursday, in the meantime here's a little vid for your enjoyment.

Todd - Organizer of the TNGH and Forever Lost in America


https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=myhnAZFR1po

If you are viewing this page on the Meetup app click the description tab to view the list of galley openings.  

If you are using an Android mobile browser and don't see the images on this page then open your browser's settings menu and click ''Request Desktop Site". 

With Apple IOS simply click the desktop site button at the bottom of the page. 

And finally :) For those new to the Hop you might be wondering how you will find the group. Well below is a lovely pictures of myself. Study my face carefully and commit it to memory. Now that I am burned into your hippocampus simply look for me hovering near the entrance to the first gallery.

The mild-mannered me

but depending on my state of mind I might look like this

Just a little more business...

Every week I receive emails from new members asking if there is a fee to join or attend the Thursday Night Gallery Hop. So rather than answer each email individually I'll kill a whole flock of birds with one stone. 


THE HOP IS, ALWAYS HAS BEEN, AND WILL REMAIN COMPLETELY FREE


That said if you would like to help offset my organizer fees or buy me a post-hop bourbon you are more than welcome to click the 'chip in' button on the left side of this page. But let me reiterate contributions while appreciated are NOT required. 

And now the openings...

results.description:
Share a Stitch

So whomever wants to share a stitch they are jazzed about let me know and and come prepared to demonstrate and laugh out loud while we stitch ourselves into a frenzy trying out your shiny new toy. 

Help, I'm stuck!

So there's this project we all have that would be totally perfect except there's one part of it that is an infernal nuisance and has us stopped in our tracks. Help a sister out. Calling all stitching ninjas! 

Let's put our heads together and help make one more great embroidery or needlepoint happen in this world. One question a member please, and let's vet them beforehand so there are no repeats.

Best Stores Ever

Ok, I am asking  you to divulge trade secrets. You know,  that PLACE that has that STUFF you can't get anywhere else and for such a bargain! Come armed with all the information we may need to go on our very own stitching supply safari.  Who knows? this topic just screams FIELD TRIP to me.

Along the same lines, member Kim Kotary has suggested a supply swap. Items bought, and shunted aside for something even more fabulous and are just sitting there making you feel like a Imelda Marcos or someone in need of an intervention. Stay Tuned - Kim has kindly offered to spearhead her nifty thrifty idea.
results.name: Share a Stitch - Help, I'm Stuck! - Best Stores Ever

results.description:
PowerShell 101

Summary:

Have you wanted to learn PowerShell, but didn't know where to start?  Have you been scared off by all the pipes and curly braces, or maybe you're just not sure what PowerShell can do for you?  This session will teach you the very basics of PowerShell and give you the fundamentals you need to start writing your own scripts and functions.  You'll also get a list of resources to continue learning and take your skills to the next level.  Make sure that you bring your laptop with you and follow along!

Bio:

Michael Wells is a Microsoft Application Solution Specialist at EMC covering enterprise customers in the New York City area. He has worked in IT since 2000 and has supported all versions of SQL Server from SQL Server 2000 to SQL Server 2014. Michael has been presenting since 2007 for local user groups, CodeCamps, SQLSaturday events, IT Pro Camps, and large conferences like PASS Summit and Oracle OpenWorld.

results.description:
Providing opportunities for work and raising wages were of paramount importance to Henry George. In George’s time minimum wage laws, pensions, social security and other benefits were unknown. In the United States, despite all these “innovations”, in 2015 median household income, adjusted for inflation, is lower than it was in 2007. Just what is happening in the labor market, in the supply and demand for workers?

Please join us as we survey the changing nature of employment; the rise of outsourcing, offshoring, crowdsourcing, freelancing, and the replacement of workers by robots and artificial intelligence. We offer some suggestions to fulfill Henry George’s objective of improving the condition of labor, the creator of all wealth.
results.name: Survey of the Labor Market – Work, Pay, and the Changing Nature of Employment

results.description:
DigitalOcean is the world’s fastest growing cloud hosting provider built for developers. Our mission is simple: we’re passionate about making complex infrastructure simple and delighting our customers with a seamless experience that brings them joy. New users can easily deploy a blazing fast cloud server in 55 seconds with an intuitive control panel interface, which can be replicated on a larger scale with the company’s straightforward API.


MEETUP AGENDA 


6:00 - Welcome / Network + Food + Drinks

6:30pm - Hacking

8:15pm - Lightning Talks

We're hosting our next Meteor Ladies Hack night at DigitalOcean!  Come bring whatever project you're working on and let's hack together! 

Got an idea for a lightning talk?  Just leave a tweet-sized description and we'll help you get set up.

If there's a topic you'd like someone to talk about, post that too!

And don't worry, you're not required to get technical.  Meteor is new, and we're learning together.

Ladies Meteor Night was created to help grow the community.  Everyone is welcome.


*** Please be sure to include your First and Last name on your RSVP by 3pm on Sept 10th to be checked in at Digital Ocean's building. ***
results.name: Ladies Hack Night

results.description: This is a social group for walkers, run/walkers, runners and triathletes. We run in the Fleet Feet neighborhood for 3 or 6 miles (approximately 30-60 minutes). The group completes a 3-mile loop. Upon returning to the store, people have the option to head out for an additional 3 miles on a slightly different route or stay. We help match you to others of a similar pace. All paces and smiley faces welcome.

results.description:
Hey! NYC-Tech for this month we're changing things up. Join us at this amazing panel. 

Tickets: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-journey-from-inception-to-institutional-funding-and-beyond-tickets-18192361844


Join OkMyOutfit, OfferPop, MINR, Glide, Lerer Hippeau Ventures and RebelMouse for an evening of lively discussion about how to start, build and grow a venture-backed company.

There are many challenges that founders face when starting a company. As a startup grows, these hurdles change. The goal of this panel is to demystify the process and educate founders in the greater NYC tech community on the various stages of fundraising and what the differences are between early and later stage fundraising. We will also talk about what founders should expect in discussions with investors as they raise subsequent rounds of capital.

We have a killer panel composed of some of the brightest stars NYC has to offer.

Mark Cooper: Mark is SVP of Business Development and Co-Founder at Offerpop. Follow Mark @markerpop

Diana Melencio: Diana is the co-founder of OkMyOutfit. Follow Diana @okmyoutfit

Sol Weinreich: Sol is CEO and co-founder of MINR. Follow Sol @solfrombrooklyn

Paul Berry: Paul is a Partner at Lerer Hippeau Ventures and CEO of RebelMouse, Follow Paul @teamreboot

Chaim Haas (moderator): Chaim is the Head of Communications at video messaging startup Glide. Follow Chaim @chaimhaas

As always, a huge thank you to WeWork for being tremendously generous and hosting us.

EVENT SCHEDULE

6-6:30 PM: Food & Networking
6:30-7:15 PM: Panel Discussion
7:15-7:45 PM: Q&A
7:45 PM: Drinks & Networking

We look forward to seeing you at the event.

Grab your tickets now!

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-journey-from-inception-to-institutional-funding-and-beyond-tickets-18192361844
results.name: Panel event at Wework Chelsea

results.description:
Please contact John at[masked] in advance of Thursday sail to check availability of room on the Yacht since there is a limit on each vessel for safety and comfort reasons. Email: [masked] 

We have 2 to 4 yachts sailing from various LI Sound locations--Mamaroneck, New Rochelle, City Island-- and we balance space available with experienced sailors and new guests.
If you would like to join a Thursday sail you should:

1. Send an email to John at least 3 days before the sail (Monday). Include the following info when you first apply: 

Name and address

Your emergency phone number

Sailing experience, None, Passenger, Crew member, Captain

2. If a friend or partner will be accompanying you please provide their information as above. 

3. Bad weather may cancel the event.  

4. The Thursday night sails are for members as well as prospective members of the United States Power Squadrons. Non members can sail  2 times during the season.  Handing in the membership application removes the 2 times restriction. Ask John for membership information.
results.how_to_find_us: Please contact John at 914-523-2140 (His contact infor will be visible once you join WSPS MeeUp) in advance of Thursday Sail to check availability of room on the yacht. You will not be able to go sailing unless you pre-register with John in advance.
results.name: Thursday Night Sails,  LI Sound

results.description:
Get better at public speaking

City Hall Toastmasters Club #735 - (Open to All ! & Feel free to bring a friend !)
Meets 2nd and 4th Thursday of the Month @ 6:00 - 7:15 PM

@St Andrews Church  20 Cardinal Hayes Place(Centre & Reade St's)
http://735.toastmastersclubs.org
toastmasterscityhall@gmail.com
Directions:  http://www.hopstop.com - Trains / Buses or http://www.mapquest.com
Hope you can make it to out next meeting & feel free to bring a friend!
St Andrews Church
20 Cardinal Hayes Place (Centre & Reade St's) Lower Manhattan District, NY, NY, 10007, United States

Doors Open at 5:50 pm. Meeting begins at 6pm.

Meetings are held every 2nd and 4th Thursday of the month.

Walking East on Reade St., you will see St. Andrews R.C. church at the end of the street. That is our building. When you come up to the church, walk around the church until you see a black iron gated walkway. Enter the walkway and enter the door on the left. The door will be open and you can come right in. Please do not bother the church staff by ringing any door bells.
results.how_to_find_us: Signs will be out the door on Toastmasters

Upon arrival, you will be treated to the VIP celebrity experience. Walk the red carpet, feel the flash of the paparazzi, and be captivated by the sounds of our special guest DJ as you dance the night away. 

Also, enjoy complimentary Hors d’oeuvres & a 2 for 1 drink special of the designer cocktail, the Crimson.

What to expect:

• Complimentary Hors d'oeuvres (6-7pm)

•  2 For 1 Designer Drink Special (The Crimson) 

• Red Carpet/Step & Repeat 

• DJ & Dancing 

• 100+ Singles (21-49) 

*First 5 Members save $5 on tickets ($20) using discount code "VIP" at checkout

GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/vip/dates/Sep-10-2015_at_0600PM

*Ticket prices will go up as event gets closer and if any tickets are left, they will be $95 at the door

Can I come alone? Yes, most come on their own. Come alone or bring friends, either way you'll have a great time.  

Why does your RSVP say +99 ? We are partnering up with VIP Events so the RSVP's shown here are only a small portion attending. 100+ will be in attendance.

Is this age or ethnic specific? This event is intended for 21-49. It is not meant to be ethnic specific. 

What do I wear? Dress to impress. No sneakers, sweats, shorts, hats. Jeans ok. 

PREPAY ONLY EVENT - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/vip/dates/Sep-10-2015_at_0600PM

Pics from last event -

results.name: VIP Exclusive Singles Event - Comp Apps, 2 For 1 Drink Special, DJ (PREPAY ONLY)

results.description:
This meetup group tends to play medium and some light weight modern strategy games. We are happy to teach new games to anyone who is open to learn.

The group is more for those who like to try new games, as we play different games depending on number and level of attendees. It's not for those who like to play particular games only, repeatedly and competitively, or not for those who don't like to teach and play with beginners.

Some ideas are:
https://boardgamegeek.com/strategygames/browse/boardgame?sort=rank&sortdir=asc

1. No reserved seats. Arrive/leave anytime but first come, first served. Not everyone shows up at 6pm, however we prefer to keep start time 6pm because The Uncommons is pretty busy by 7pm and we have better chance to get seats early.

2. Feel free to play with others from this group and others. There will be many more game lovers at The Uncommons and often people jump into games asking if there are extra spots.

3. Please pay $5 per person table charge including game use directly to the casher. This meetup group and organizer(s) do not get any money from the event.

The Uncommons have 500+ games on shelf.
http://www.uncommonsnyc.com/

4. Come anytime but if some games are in progress, please wait (do not interrupt - save big introduction chat for between games), look around if other games have a spot to join, or feel free to start new game by yourself and ask around if others are interested.

This is not the type of event that someone greets you at door and walks through. If you can not find us, ask at the casher. (If you post "I'm here, find me", we may not see it until the game ends or even until the night ends.)

5. If you want to play particular game and start at particular time, please post message to ask if anyone else is interested.
results.how_to_find_us: Ask at the casher. Check other attendees' ETA on post if any.
results.name: Weekly Thursday Gaming @ The Uncommons Village Manhattan

results.description:
Updated March 8th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside as a backup.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description:
Those interested in preserving community gardens should attend the meeting. There will be an agenda item at the next Community Board Meeting about preserving the Community Gardens in East Harlem on City-HPD owned land. This is the agenda for the meeting.
Environment, Open Space, & Parks Committee
Thursday, September 10, 2015, 6:00 p.m.
Board Office

1. Call to Order- Adoption of the Agenda

a. Welcome new full board member Marie Winfield

2. Presentations & Discussions

a. Informational presentation on the various types of existing community gardens, playgrounds and open spaces in East Harlem

i. Charlie Reynoso, NYRP, and Nancy Kohn, Greenthumb.

b. Informational presentation on Pleasant Village Community Garden's programming

i. Katie Benn, President of Pleasant Village Community Garden (118th-119th Streets on Pleasant Avenue)

3. Continuing Business

a. Request for a letter of support for the erection of a score board in Lincoln Playground (135th Street and Fifth Avenue)

i. Russell Schuler

4. Informational Updates

a. East Harlem Neighborhood Study update

i. Economic Development, Workforce Development and Small Business Community Visioning Workshop, Thursday, September 10th at 6:30 pm at Children's Aid Society.

5. New Business

a. Draft Statement of District Needs FY17 Discussion

i. Review of the new guidelines for the Statement of District Needs and Budget Priorities for FY17; the Committee will consider adding new budget items.

b. FY17 Budget Priorities Discussion

c. The Committee Chair will introduce a drafted plan for the Committee to consider in an effort to preserve vulnerable community gardens that have been held for years by HPD and are now subject to development

6. Announcements
results.name: HPD community gardens on agenda at CB11 Parks in East Harlem

results.description:
Would you like to -

• Become a more confident public speaker?

•Feel more at-ease during business meetings and social occasions?

•Make new friends, in a supportive and encouraging environment?

The friendly people at Pride Toastmasters would love to help you improve your public speaking skills, as you boost your leadership and self confidence skills! We focus on making our guests very welcome. We meet every Thursday from 6:15 p.m. until 7:25 at the LGBT Center, 208 W 13th St, New York, NY 10011. If you arrive early, expect to be warmly greeted and given an overview of what to expect during the fun, informative and engaging meeting! 

By the way, there’s nothing for you to prepare in advance of our meeting, no fee to pay as our guest and no pressure to join.  Please do visit and sample this exciting option for personal and professional growth!

An average of 20 members and guests attend each Pride Toastmasters meeting. Since most aren't members of Meetup, the attendance figures shown here are always much lower.

Please visit our web site at http://www.PrideToastmasters.com

results.description:
Hear first hand from a panel of new parents about their experiences having satisfying hospital births. Additionally, meet New York City providers, including Park Slope-based hospital and birth center midwife, Chris McCloskey CNM, who will be on hand to answer your questions as you consider what is best for you.

Are you planning to give birth in a hospital or at an in-hospital birth center?
Are you planning a home birth but want information on how to have as positive an experience as possible should a transfer become necessary?
Are you looking for ways you can modify the Labor & Delivery room to make it more relaxing? Please join Choices in Childbirth and facilitators Shara Frederick and Clare Friedrich on September 10 at 6:15pm for this month’s “All About Birth Workshop: How to Have a Great Hospital Birth.”

RSVP: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/how-to-have-a-great-hospital-birth-tickets-17431537197

results.description:
Pre-Dive Orientation and Academic Review

This is a REQUIRED session for anyone planning on doing the certification dives this weekend.

• We will review your SDI Academics. 

• Equipment Requirements

• Dive Planning

Get here extra early to pick up any required or additional equipment you might need for the dives. You should review the equipment checklist.

Finally! Certification Dives are just a few days away.

Before getting certified every diver must come in and review their completed academics with the instructor.

Bring your:

• Completed Final exam

• Skills Checklist

•  Basic OW planner (print from website)

• Introduction to Dive Computers


Using Dive Computers

To help familiarize you with how Underwater Dive Computers work, use the following links: Introduction to Dive Computers. (There is a nominal fee) Using an Underwater computer is one of the safest ways to dive today. Computers are relatively inexpensive and very reliable. Putting the tools you need to complete a safe and fun dive right in your hand. Enroll and complete online course,  when finished printout and bring us the results/certificate. Introduction to Dive Computers

</a>

<a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/pdfs/whybuymyown.pdf">Why Buy My Own Equipment? Diving more than most other sports requires reliable equipment and instruction on its proper use. Don’t listen to an inexperienced expert or be fooled by the online hype, you get the best gear right here, from the people you can trust.

EQUIPMENT: You are responsible for having all the gear you need to dive this weekend. Arrange equipment rentals with the shop.and pick up any rental equipment you will need. You will be wearing a thicker wetsuit, which you must try on to ensure proper fit. Purchasing Neoprene gloves is also highly recommended. Scuba Gear required for Certification Dives.

Additionally you will need

SDI Logbook

Planning Slate

Equipment requirements for Certification Dives

Wetsuit (6mm or 7mm)

Hood

Weights and weight belt

BCD (Buoyancy Compensator Device)

Regulator

Dive Computer 

SCUBA Cylinder

You should reserve your equipment in advance and pick it up before the weekend. You are responsible for transporting all the equipment needed to complete your certification dives.

Call us with any questions. [masked]

Print out a few copies of the dive planner to bring with you tonight. Basic OW planner
results.how_to_find_us: 2nd floor

results.description:
Free pizza, swag, beer, drinks & much more!

Alexander "Sasha" Sicular, Senior Solution Architect, Basho

RSVP NOW at http://www.NYCSQL.com/events/224941803/

A Database Month event:
http://www.DatabaseMonth.com/database/riak-redis-solr-spark

In this session, we will walk you through the technology landscapes involved in utilizing the super-stack - from NoSQL databases to caching with Redis to analytics with Apache Spark. We will cover the nuanced complexities of real-world environments, from dual-writer inconsistencies to eventual consistency to cache re-indexing.

You will leave with both a logical and technological view of how to create a production-grade super-stack platform that leverages Riak KV as a scalable, distributed database, and integrates these toolsets in a way that runs smoothly from prototype to production.

We will use the example of a product-catalogue that begins with an RDBMS backend and grows in complexity as business requirements require them to do so. By the end of the session, you will learn about system architectures, the databases involved and how to weave together the technologies necessary for today's application super-stack.

Alexander "Sasha" Sicular, Senior Solution Architect, Basho
With over 16 years of experience in medical informatics at Columbia University, Alexander has worked to design and develop clinical information systems used to exceed challenges posed by regulatory compliance, operational efficiency, data quality and research. At Basho, Alexander works closely with customers who are looking to augment their traditional stack or build greenfield applications on Riak.

RSVP: http://www.NYCSQL.com/events/224941803/

Pizza + swag giveaway + junk-food/drinks at 6:30pm
Power-Networking at 6:35pm
Presentation starts at 6:40pm

You can save children from homelessness through the Techie Youth program!
Please learn how you can save the life of a child at http://www.TechieYouth.org
(saving child's life is very easy!)

RSVP Now at http://www.NYCSQL.com/events/224941803/

venue.name: The Cliffs at Long Island City

results.description:
Let's climb together at this newly opened indoor rock climbing spot - The Cliffs at LIC - the newest & largest indoor rock climbing gym in NYC area. Mention NYC Active group for receive specials for our meetups (Listed below). 

Specials for our meetup:

• First-time climbers will receive free rental gear. It must be the first visit to the facility and with scheduled meet-up.
• The $99 initiation fee is waived for month-to-month membership for meet-up members if they sign up on a meet-up day.
• Meet-up members will receive 50% off (enter promo code HALF-PRICE-CARD) on the Climbing 101 class on the day of their meet-up. Classes must be booked in advance.

The Cliffs at LIC features:

Expertly-set routes for all levels of climbing experience + ability 
• Over 30,000 square feet of climbing terrain
• Over 125 top rope stations and tons of lead climbing
• 16-foot top-out bouldering
• Professional instructors with a passion for climbing
• Separate Party Room for events + classes
• Full fitness gym
No experience necessary!
Each participant must have a waiver (to be filled out by a parent or guardian for participants under 18)!

Date/Time: Every Thursday 6:30 pm to 10:00 pm

REGULAR PRICING Posted at Cliffs LIC Website

Day Pass // $28
College Day Pass* // $24
1-Month Pass // $140
Learn to Climb 1-Month Package // $149
10-Visit Pass // $250
Memberships // Click for details

*Full-time college student ages 18-25

RENTALS

Climbing Shoes // $6
Harness // $5
Chalk Bag // $3
Package // $12

Click Here for details on memberships.

CLIMBING 101: TOPROPE BASICS

The facility includes climbing & fitness

Location (Map)

[masked]th Dr
Long Island City
Queens, NY 11101 
(718) 729-ROCK (7625)

Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days
Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

If you are a total beginner to indoor climbing (never climbed or belayed before), you will need to take a class. Please book "Climbing 101: TopRope Basics" at 6:30 pm on Tuesday by entering promo code HALF-PRICE-CARD or call[masked] & mention NYC Active meetup to get 50% off. This class will teach you how to tie the rope and belay your climbing partner. Gear rental is included in the class. You can still do boulder without taking the class or being belay certified though.

If you are new to The Cliffs at LIC but have been belayed certified in other gym, you can take a test & it will only take few minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please feel free to see me & we can practice together.

More info: http://lic.thecliffsclimbing.com/

8:30 - 9:00 PM: Socializing

Applying Natural Language Processing to Automated Grammatical Error Correction for Language Learning

A fast growing area in Natural Language Processing (NLP) is the use of automated tools for identifying and correcting grammatical errors made by language learners. This growth, in part, has been fueled by the needs of a large number of people in the world who are learning and using a second or foreign language. For example, it is estimated that there are currently over one billion people who are non-native speakers of English. These numbers drive the demand for accurate tools that can help learners to write and speak proficiently in another language. Such demand also makes this an exciting time for those in the NLP community who are developing automated methods for grammatical error correction (GEC).

While there have been many exciting developments in GEC over the last few years, there is still considerable room for improvement as state-of-the-art performance in detecting and correcting several important error types is still inadequate for many real world applications.  In this talk, I will provide an overview of the field of automated grammatical error correction, including its history, leading methodologies and its particular set of challenges.  Although applications of GEC are often geared toward the classroom, its methods are more generally applicable to a wide variety of NLP problems, especially where systems must contend with noisy data, such as MT evaluation and correction, analysis of microblogs and other user-generated content, and disfluency detection in speech.

If time permits, we'll play with a simple grammatical error codebase (using Python and the Vowpal Wabbit machine learning toolkit) to predict the correct preposition in an English sentence.

Speaker bio:

Joel Tetreault is a Senior Research Scientist at Yahoo Labs in New York City.  His research focus is Natural Language Processing with specific interests in anaphora, dialogue and discourse processing, machine learning, and applying these techniques to the analysis of English language learning and automated essay scoring.  Previously he was Principal Manager of the Core Natural Language group at Nuance Communications, Inc. where he worked on the research and development of NLP tools and components for the next generation of intelligent dialogue systems.  Prior to Nuance, he worked at Educational Testing Service for six years as a Managing Senior Research Scientist where he researched automated methods for detecting grammatical errors by non-native speakers, plagiarism detection, and content scoring.  Tetreault received his B.A. in Computer Science from Harvard University and his M.S. and Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Rochester.  He was also a postdoctoral research scientist at the University of Pittsburgh's Learning Research and Development Center, where he worked on developing spoken dialogue tutoring systems.  In addition he has co-organized the Building Educational Application workshop series for 8 years, the CoNLL 2013 Shared Task on Grammatical Error Correction, and is currently NAACL Treasurer.
results.name: NLP for Automated Grammatical Error Correction

results.description:
Free pizza, swag, beer, drinks & much more! 

Alexander "Sasha" Sicular, Senior Solution Architect, Basho 

RSVP Now at: http://www.NYCSQL.com/events/224941803 

A Database Month event:
http://www.DatabaseMonth.com/database/riak-redis-solr-spark

In this session, we will walk you through the technology landscapes involved in utilizing the super-stack - from NoSQL databases to caching with Redis to analytics with Apache Spark. We will cover the nuanced complexities of real-world environments, from dual-writer inconsistencies to eventual consistency to cache re-indexing. You will leave with both a logical and technological view of how to create a production-grade super-stack platform that leverages Riak KV as a scalable, distributed database, and integrates these toolsets in a way that runs smoothly from prototype to production. We will use the example of a product-catalogue that begins with an RDBMS backend and grows in complexity as business requirements require them to do so. By the end of the session, you will learn about system architectures, the databases involved and how to weave together the technologies necessary for today's application super-stack. 

Alexander "Sasha" Sicular, Senior Solution Architect, Basho
With over 16 years of experience in medical informatics at Columbia University, Alexander has worked to design and develop clinical information systems used to exceed challenges posed by regulatory compliance, operational efficiency, data quality and research. At Basho, Alexander works closely with customers who are looking to augment their traditional stack or build greenfield applications on Riak.

RSVP Now at: http://www.NYCSQL.com/events/224941803

results.description:
A man dies on the operating table, and Inspector Cockrill suspects murder

As German V-1 rockets rain down on the English countryside, the men and women of the military hospitals fight to stay calm. The morning after a raid, Doctor Barnes prepares for a routine surgery to repair a postman’s broken leg. But with general anesthesia, there is always danger. Before the first incision is made, the postman turns purple. Barnes and his nurses do what they can, but the patient is dead in minutes.

The coroner calls for an inquest. Barnes has a history of lost patients, and cannot afford more trouble. Scotland Yard Detective Inspector Cockrill is unimpressed by the staff at the hospital, which he finds a nest of jealousy, indiscretion, and bitterness. One of them, doctor or nurse, murdered the postman—and it won’t be long before they kill again. (Mysterious Press)

DevOps with Puppet

- 2015 DevOps Report

- High Level overview of Puppet Enterprise with a live demonstration

-Configuration management tools that let you define a desired state for your infrastructure and then automatically enforce that state.

-DevOps function of treating "infrastructure as code"

-A web-based console UI and APIs for analyzing events, managing your nodes and users, and editing resources on the fly.

-Powerful orchestration capabilities.

About Jeremiah Sullivan

Jeremiah Sullivan is a Technical Solutions Engineer for Puppet Labs.  Jeremiah is a long time Linux user and most recently has focused on bringing automation solutions into heterogeneous IT environments.

About Puppet Labs:

Puppet Labs' primary product, Puppet Enterprise,comprises a commercially supported version of its open-source configuration management tool, Puppet. Puppet IT automation software uses Puppet's declarative language to manage various stages of the IT infrastructure lifecycle, including the provisioning, patching, configuration, and management of operating system and application components across enterprise data centers and cloud infrastructures

About ROKITT:


ROKITT develops digital products for consumers across various industries. It also drives solutions for enterprises to enable more efficient technology delivery.

ROKITT Products are developed to disrupt “old ways” and drive progressive evolution across multiple industries and segments. 

ROKITT Solutions are solving long standing IT operational challenges faced by enterprises by blending SME knowledge with revolutionary technology frameworks that accelerate IT execution strategy for Mobility, Quality, Data Management & Security.

ROKITT has established a global presence with offices in Jersey City, Ukraine and India.

Please visit www.rokittech.com to learn more

It should be a very lively night of men & women socializing over the game, featuring the Pittsburg Steelers vs. the Super Bowl Champions, New England Patriots.


Our Meetup:

Our group will meetup starting @ 6:30pm at the long tables near the bar, which are reserved for us. There will be complimentary Fish Tacos, Fried Green Tomatoes (for the vegetarians), Cheeseburger & Turkey Burger Sliders served @ 7:30pm for those arriving on the earlier side. Food is limited to serving around 40-50 folks, so first come, first served.

Additionally, Harlem Tavern is extending their regular happy hour drink specials for our group until 8:30pm (normally 7pm). For the extended happy hour, wristband will be given to members - please see Daniel to get a wristband.

Our group will be located at two of the long tables reserved in front of the bar - if enough of us show up early, we can possibly grab all three or get additional tables! Of course, there will be plenty of opportunity to meet new people outside the group as well, who are simply checking out the game & atmosphere at Harlem Tavern. The meetup will end at the conclusion of the game, which should be around 11:30pm.

Directions to Harlem Tavern:

Harlem Tavern is located at 2153 Frederick Douglass Blvd (at 116th St.) The closest subway stop is the B & C local train lines to the 116th Street station. Nearby bus lines include the M10, M7, & M3.

As always, please feel free to call/text Daniel @[masked] if you have any questions, running late, etc...see you there!

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Come out to the first SingApplause! Session of the Fall season!

Practice performing your songs at SingApplause!© This session gives you a chance to try out the music you’ve been working on in a safe, supportive and fun environment!

If you want try out a new song, brush up on an older one, present an original song or try out an entirely new style, SingApplause! is the place for you!

SingApplause! is simple, one person sings, everyone else applauds, and then the next person takes a turn, that’s it!

There’s no criticism, no coaching, no skills evaluation or any other negative commentary.  So whether you're a professional singer, amateur, wedding/event singer or songwriter - SingApplause! is for you!

If you are working on an aria, art song, spiritual, theater song, original song, jazz standard, whatever! - This session is for you!

We have a lot of fun in these sessions, so I hope you can make it and join in the fun!

Dr. Richard Duncan, Pianist (extraordinary pianist that can play just about any sheet music you give him!)

results.description:
Metamorphic Technique Free Talk in NYC

Do you want to grow yourself and your life but don’t know how?
Do you want more out life: more health, abundance and love?
Would you like to support your partner, children or parents, when they are stuck or struggling?
Are you a practitioner ready to add a new modality to your work?
Are you ready to transform your life in a way that is right for you?

Discover a radically new way of working with the power of Life within us, for profound shifts on all levels of our being. The Metamorphic Technique is gentle touch which acts as a catalyst to the transformational power of your own Life Force. There is no need to discuss issues or problems. Anyone can learn MT and use it in their life. After sessions people often make quantum leaps in their lives. Sometimes this shows up as a physical healing, moving out of old life circumstances, improving relationships, finding a new partner, profound healing of whole families and much more ( go to the Blogs page to read about these amazing shifts)

This technique was developed in England in the 1970’s by a Reflexologist who noticed that when he lightly stroked the spinal reflex points on the foot, it corresponded to our time in the womb where we set up the cellular blueprint for our life. These cells anchor the patterns which shape and challenge us during our lifetime. By lightly stroking these points it acts as a catalyst, allowing you to grow yourself and transform any stuck places, in a way that will always be right for you. Metamorphic Technique is easy to learn and wonderful to receive. The workshop is an empowering teaching full of aha moments. MT is a catalyst for deep and lasting transformation from within. It has been used with couples struggling to conceive, during pregnancy, throughout life and even when loved ones are dying. Through this practice we say Yes to Life and Yes to letting Life grow us from within. The Free Talk: Thursday September 10th, 7pm-8.30pm

Join me to find out if the Metamorphic Technique can support you in your evolution. We will cover:
-how to access our transformational nature by not getting in our own way
-how to transform our life
-the theory behind this unit approach
-amazing stories of serious health issues resolved , families healed, infertility reversed, stuck-ness and blocks removed
-why simple touch like this acts as a catalyst allowing you to transform yourself
-why our time in the womb sets up the blueprint for our life
-about the awakening of the heart and the shift on the planet
-why Metamorphic Technique is the perfect practice for challenging times and difficult situations
-why MT is the perfect approach when you have tried everything else
-about Dominique’s own powerful quantum leap after discovering MT

Dominique Mallee Meeroff is one of the world’s leading Metamorphic Technique teachers. She has been through a powerful transformation and is passionate about supporting others in that process. She is Canadian and after 7 years in NYC she moved to the UK in 1994. She trained with the founder of the work and travels all around the world teaching. This is the first workshop in NYC.

The Workshop
Saturday September 12th 11.30am-6pm
Sunday September 13th 11.30am-6pm
Contribution $150 (10% off for A.R.E members)
Where: Edgar Cayce Center: 241 W 30th St, 2nd fl (buzz 102#), New York, NY 10001 |[masked]

Find out more about Dominique and the Metamorphic Technique here.

results.description:
Join us for a unique wine experience on September 10. Learn about how the shape of a glass changes the taste of a wine. And bring home a set of Riedel red wine glasses (cab, syrah and pinot noir).


The wines at the tasting will be: 

• Stags' Leap Winery Napa Valley Cabernet (ratings from 90 to 93) 

• Penfolds Bin 28 Kalimna Shiraz (ratings from 90 to 92) 

• Etude Carneros Pinot Noir (ratings from 90 to 94)

RIEDEL Crystal is a 300 year-old family owned company known for its creation and development of varietal-specific stemware. RIEDEL Crystal is the first in history to recognize that the taste of a beverage is affected by the shape of the vessel from which it is consumed, and has been recognized for its revolutionary designs complementing alcoholic beverages and other drinks.

The tasting is designed to help educate on the difference drinking wine from the right glass can make, and will include a chocolate and wine pairing demonstration. Georg J Riedel, the tenth-generation head of Riedel Crystal, developed these tastings in order to add another layer of enjoyment and complexity to the wine drinking experience and to demonstrate how the shape of the glass truly makes a difference in not only the taste of wine, but in the way chocolate tastes when consumed after drinking wine from the proper glass. 

Riedel has performed varietal-specific tastings throughout the world for more than 45 years, educating more than 20,000 consumers annually. Riedel’s tastings brings more depth and discovery to the wine drinking experience – an enhanced sensory experience building on the tastings developed over the course of three generations of Riedel family leadership.

Please note that we will need to provide 41 Madison with a guest list a day prior to the event for security.
results.name: Great Wines and the Glasses That Love Them: Set of Riedel Glasses included!

results.description:
Ingrid Bergman: A Centennial Celebration

August 29 marks the 100th anniversary of Ingrid Bergman’s birth, an occasion MoMA will observe with a selection of films from her 50-year career—as chosen and, where possible, introduced by her children Pia Lindstrom, Roberto Rossellini, Jr., Isabella Rossellini, and Isotta Ingrid Rossellini.

The emotional transparency of Bergman’s performing style blended with her great natural beauty to create a different kind of movie star. When she arrived in America, in 1939, to star in a remake of her 1936 Swedish film Intermezzo, the producer David O. Selznick recognized in the 24-year-old a new freshness and accessibility—a radical break with the artificially elaborate notions of “glamor” that had been synonymous with female stars in Hollywood since the late silent era. In films like Casablanca (1942), Gaslight (1944) and Notorious (1946), Bergman seemed to speak directly to her public, cutting through melodramatic conventions.

Bergman’s search for authenticity eventually led to Italy, where she made five features with the pioneering Neorealist director Roberto Rossellini, a body of work now recognized as one of the foundations of modern cinema. After her relationship with Rossellini ended, Bergman continued to work with some of the medium’s most creative filmmakers. Her last theatrical film, Ingmar Bergman’s Autumn Sonata (1978), brought her back to her native Sweden.


 Autumn Sonata

1978. Sweden. Written and directed by Ingmar Bergman. With Ingrid Bergman, Liv Ullman, Lena Nyman, Halvar Björk. After seven years of separation, an internationally famous concert pianist (Ingrid Bergman) returns home to visit her long-suffering daughter (Liv Ullman), who has a bagful of bones to pick with her neglectful, self-centered mother. Simmering resentment explodes into a night of mutual recrimination. A difficult collaboration for both director and star, Autumn Sonata blends painful material lifted from the lives of both Bergmans with plotting from a Hollywood melodrama. Courtesy Janus Films. Selected by Pia Lindström. In Swedish, English subtitles. 99 min.

For admissions and visitor information  click here: http://www.moma.org/visit/plan/index#filmticketing
results.name: Ingrid Bergman: A Centennial Celebration - Autumn Sonata
