results.description:
Public Talk with Professor Andrew Quintman

REGISTER NOW 

Late in the eleventh century a wandering mendicant, the Yogin, starved himself in the frigid mountains of southern Tibet while undertaking ascetic practice. He was later recognized as a buddha famed for his poetry and songs of spiritual realization. Four hundred years later, a tantric adept emerged from the jungles of Tibet's borderlands, naked, human entrails wound in his dangling dreadlocks. This adept, the Madman, composed a new and novelistic version of the Yogin's life. The story it told of a great Tibetan saint would inspire new forms of religious literature across the Himalayan world, new styles of artistic production, newtraditions of spiritual practice. In time, the Madman's version of the Yogin's life would become Tibet's most famous book.  

In this lecture, Professor Andrew Quintman explores the extraordinary life story of Yogin Milarepa, drawing on his new book,The Yogin and the Madman: Reading the Biographical Corpus of Tibet's Great Saint Milarepa, tracing its historical formation, changing narrative voices, and enduring legacy across the Tibetan region. He presents a new way of readingThe Life of Milarepa by foregrounding the unique relationship between Yogin and Madman together with the processes through which the narrative took shape.

Suggested Donation: 

$20.  (Shantideva Meditation Center, Tibet House, and Nalanda Institute Members: $18.)

Suggested donations may be made online or at the door. 

Registration:

To register, click here.

About the Speaker:

Andrew Quintman is Associate Professorof Religious Studies at Yale University, specializing in the Buddhist traditions of Tibet and the Himalaya. His book, The Yogin and the Madman: Reading the Biographical Corpus of Tibet's Great Saint Milarepa (Columbia University Press, 2014)won the American Academy of Religion's 2014 Award for Excellence in the Study of Religion and the 2015 Heyman Prize for outstanding scholarship from Yale University. His English translation of The Life of Milarepa was published by Penguin Classics in 2010. He is currently writing a history of Drakar Taso Monastery in Tibet's southern border region and a study of the Buddha's life story through the visual and literary materials of Jonang Monastery in western Tibet.
results.name: The Making of Milarepa: Reading the Life  of Tibet's Great Poet and Saint

Also, some ticket categories have sold out but you can still pay whatever you can afford on the remaining option.  So, don't delay - buy your tickets at:  www.offandon.eventbrite.com

See you at BAM on Thursday - doors open at 6:30pm

******************************************
I hope you can join us the evening of September 10th at the Brooklyn Academy of Music for an important event we’re calling Off and On: The Climate Movement & the Road Through Paris

Naomi Klein, Rev. Lennox Yearwood of the Hip Hop Caucus, Eddie Bautista of the New York Environmental Justice Alliance, and a bunch of special guests will be coming together to lay out why this year could be such a dramatic turning point for our movement.

We’re living through the hottest year in recorded history. We’re fighting pitched battles against tar sands oil, Australian coal mines, and Arctic drilling, not to mention fracking, pipelines, and the companies and portfolios that bankroll them. It’s a battle not just for climate sanity, but for climate justice. And at the same time we’re living through the year that will see the most renewable energy ever installed. There’s suddenly a chance for transformative change on a scale that just might matter.

But that change requires breaking the power of the fossil fuel industry, and it involves all of us. This is our night to try and set an agenda for the Paris talks and the months beyond them. That crucial conference won’t actually solve our problems -- but it is, however, a great moment to demonstrate the growing, global power of this movement.

We can’t take this event everywhere across the planet, at least not live. Instead we’re going to record this evening in Brooklyn, and make sure it gets out as widely as is digitally possible. But there will be 2000 of us in the room that night, and I’m very hopeful you’ll be one of them. Tickets are available on a sliding scale, so you can pay what you can afford or think is right. But soon, please, because this will fill up. 

Onward— 

Bill McKibben

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Click here to get your ticket and join climate movement leaders from across the globe in New York City to discuss where the climate movement has come in the wake of the historic People's Climate March, and where we must go in 2015 and beyond.
results.name: Off and On:  The Climate Movement & the Road Through Paris

results.description:
The Sound Mind gathering explores the vibrational and sound healing for personal meditation, soul expansion, as well as physical well-being. 

When we learn to use our breath and voice for toning, chanting, and psychosomatic actualization, we become powerful healers. The gifts we were born to share come to fruition if we but dare to explore, expand, AND express our vibrational state. You can tune your Soul-Body to higher dimensions and progress your visionary abilities following the scale of sound and color - starting where you are and who you are at the present moment and then climbing up.

The starting point is like looking at a hiking map with a little red circle that says 'you are here' and all the possible trails ahead and then you take off - transcendence path is a process that is anchored in the body. No matter how natural and sacred, there is no vine, shroom, or chemical that will take you to the next level of spiritual consciousness. You can change your state and catch a glimpse of your transcendent vision, yes, right here within your Soul-Body.

Sound Mind is about a durable and steady progress into who you were meant to become in this amazing moment of opportunity that we call a human life. It goes fast, so why not …make a sound?
results.name: Sound Mind - Heal Your Life with Sounding, Toning, and Chanting

results.description:
The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for three years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

If you feel uncomfortable leaving your personal belongings at the track, you can drop them off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team.  They will store our belongings for us.  ***Please note that they will not let you in without your ID so please bring that with you to the track.   http://www.acebar.com/about.html

See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!
results.name: East River Park Track Workout

results.description:
The functionality and purpose of Big Data is obvious in regards to the world of news, advertising, transportation, and research. Yet, one of the biggest owners of data, Google, is also one of the biggest companies in the world of robotics. In the past few years alone Google has purchased over 60 drone companies. Something where the Google algorithm for robots is similar to an integrated intelligence system like the movie Terminator proposed in 1984 with Skynet.

Yet, big data is now keeping people in an isolated world with things like personalized news feeds and everything being customized according to a person's internet and phone activity. This is a discussion to debate is big data good for humanity?

Feel free to recommend a location.

Please make sure to RSVP on Eventbrite https://www.eventbrite.com/e/big-data-day-tickets-18548130959

results.description:
Its open board game night! Grab some friends and your favorite board game and head on over to the Highlander location in Boonton to have some fun.  Don't have a game, or interested in playing a new one?  We've got an extensive demo library open to everyone so feel free to pick whichever game strikes your fancy, grab a group, and play. 


Additionally there will be a featured demo of a different game each week, I'll be updating this meetup each week so you guys know what we've got. 


Other than that feel free to use this meetup as a way to organize your own games for Thursday nights, we've got space for everyone and plenty of people already show up so picking up a group should be no problem at all.  Hope to see you there!
results.name: Open Board Game Night

results.description:
You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills! This session is open to sketchers of all levels.

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for the drawing class on the second floor.
results.name: Thursday - Live Model Drawing - Union Square

results.description:
Karen's 5 Week Adult Summer Raw Food Group Coaching Program

with Award-Winning Author, Motivational Speaker 
and 20 Years Raw Food Coach and Chef,

Karen Ranzi, M.A.

 Come Learn Delicious and Simple Easy-to-Prepare Juices, Smoothies, Cereals, Pancakes, Veggie Pasta and Sauces, Salads and Dressings, Main Meal Entrees, and Party Foods!

Come learn about the benefits of a healthy raw food diet which brings you health, energy, excellent immunity to illness, and your goals for ideal weight.

Receive magazines and article handouts to provide the reasons that the raw food lifestyle is successful for so many people, both in healing disease, losing weight and maintaining health. Receive guidance and support from Karen Ranzi, M.A., internationally renowned speaker and health coach, in an intimate group environment. Taste delicious and simple raw food recipes to immediately incorporate into your daily lifestyle. Learn about using greens, sprouting, and avoiding a haphazard raw food diet. Learn about detoxification, eating raw in the winter, traveling raw, water filtration, personal care products, dealing with societal pressures, local resources, and so much more.

In these 5 sessions, we will create breakfast meals, salads with dressings and sauces, veggie pasta and toppings, main meal entrees and raw cheese, and party foods.

Included is a copy of Karen's new recipe ebook 21 Days of Raw with loads of great recipes and easy meal plans. All organic food is also included in the price of this workshop.

RSVP now for the next 5 week raw food group support for the following dates:

Thursdays, September 10, 17, 24, October 1, 22

Time: 7 pm to 9 pm

Super Inexpensive Cost for your Health for the 5 Week Program:

$195 early rate for all 5 classes by August 31, $225 after August 31

Cost includes Raw Vegan Recipe ebook, Health Magazines, Handouts and articles, as well as costs of all organic food for weekly demos. Our food demo preparations include Breakfast Raw Food, Salads with Dressings and Sauces, Pasta and Burgers, Main Meals and Party Foods.

Some of the many benefits of the raw or high raw food lifestyle:

Reach your ideal weight.

Increase resistance to and heal from illness.

Gain more energy and concentration.

Lift brain fog.

Improve digestion and assimilation.

Get delicious raw food recipes for busy people.

Enjoy group support and make friends with other health-conscious individuals.

Take your health to a new level.

Location: NJ Raw Food Support Network

42 New England Drive

Ramsey, NJ 07446

Contact: To RSVP, email Karen at [masked] or call 
[masked]

Karen Ranzi is the winner of the 6th Annual Best of Raw Awards Top Professional Simple Raw Foods Chef.

Karen's book Creating Healthy Children won the Bronze Medal "Living Now Award" in the Category of Health and Nutrition from Independent Publishers.

Karen is also the author of Raw Vegan Recipe Fun for Families: 115 Easy Recipes and Health Tips for Energetic Living.

results.description:
We are looking forward to seeing you at our upcoming meet-up event on September 10, 2015 from 7:00 PM to 9:00PM. We will have 2- guest speakers, who will talk about the projects that they are doing, their insight on their industries or other topics, as long as they are related to U.S. -China business opportunities and would interest the audience.

Tonight's guest speaker is  Szekin Wong 

Szekin Wong is a translator from Pendleton Translations Ltd. who is fluent in English, Mandarin Chinese, Cantonese and Taiwanese-Minnan.  Born and attended primary and secondary schools in the then British colony of Hong Kong which is now a Special Administrative Region in the People's Republic of China, he obtained degrees from University of Wisconsin-Madison and Yale University.  Throughout the years he has worked primarily in translation projects from source language English into target langauge Chinese, and also taught in tertiary institutions and became a DJ/Producer in Metro Chinese Broadcasting.

We will also have networking time at the beginning and end of the event. 


We accept applications from the members who are interested to be our guest speakers for this event. Just send us an email and tell us what topic you would be interested in and we will confirm with you soon. We will post the guest speakers' brief bio and the topics that they will  discuss several days before the event starts. 


Refreshment will be provided. $10 contribution will be really appreciated. Thank you!

results.description:
Bridgeview Tavern is a great pub located in Sleepy Hollow. On any given night, you can meet a young family, a cycling team, girlfriends grabbing drinks, or bros watching the game.

Reasons why you should come out:

• A tavern. With a view. Of a bridge!

• One of the best beer selections in Westchester County, including rare finds from Vermont breweries like Hill Farmstead and Lost Nation.

• Awesome pub food, including solid burgers, amazing wings, and BBQ that's smoked-in house.

• Big screen TV's in the bar to watch the Yankees vs. Blue Jays game.

• 1/2 mile from the Tarrytown Metro-North stop. 


Getting Here:
Beekman Ave. is located just off of Route 9 in Sleepy Hollow, and Bridgeview Tavern is located just 1/2 mile down that road. Once you arrive, parking is available in the fenced-in lot on the side of the building, and also on Beekman Ave. and Hudson Ave.

You can also walk to Bridgeview from the Tarrytown Metro-North station (it's just a 10-minute walk).
results.name: Let's grab a pint and some BBQ at Bridgeview Tavern!

results.description:
Introduction into the discounted Note Business

The Note Business is simple. The discounted note market begins with a lender selling a pool of Notes at a discount.  It is more cost effective to package notes and sell them for cash than to hire additional staff and create workouts over time.

The discounted note business is a learn by doing business. Every homeowner situation is unique and relevant.  First you must understand the business and then you will be able to create and earn passive income for now or retirement.

Attend this Introduction into the Note Business Session to learn the following:

1) Understand Key Terms

2) How to Find Deals

3) Evaluate & Buy

4) How to exit the deal

5) How to create passive income

There are unlimited possibilities in notes to make quick cash, monthly income, and build long term wealth.

Our goal in the group is to build a note community by teaching investors how to capitalize on the foreclosure crisis by buying discounted notes for pennies on the dollar.

Purchasing discounted notes is another alternative to buying foreclosure or owning rental properties.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in the upper level (Private section)
results.name: Learning about Discounted Notes

This will be workshop about IoT and Drone technology software   Please RSVP on Eventbrite

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/hacking-for-iot-and-drones-tickets-18548100869


The main speaker, Lex Dreitser, has worked on

FollowPlants - an IoT based plant marketplace where the plants do the marketing. Growers set up our internet enabled devices and every time they water their plants, they tweet. People follow the tweets back to the plant's profile and buy direct from the grower. Winner at Tech Crunch Disrupt

IoT Control Watch - A pebble watch to control any and all electronics including drones. 

Lex will discuss basics about IoT/Drones tech as this is a single event for beginners and not meant to be overwhelming.

results.description:

results.description:
Women Traveling Solo 101

Travel Boldy. Travel Smart. Travel Solo.

September 10, 2015

7:00 - 8:30 p.m.

In this signature HI USA Travel Workshop, you'll learn the basics of traveling solo.  You'll walk away with the confidence and skills to get there and away, stay in hostels, and how to adopt a basic credo of cultural respect and approaching unique situations.  Workshop leader Erica Turner will share time-tested skills, safety pointers, and general travel resources on how to get the most out of your travel experience.  Additionally, she'll share tips, tricks and practical  advice from her own travels on what works best for solo female travelers.  The workshop will be interactive and include exercises and discussions about solo travel experiences, itinerary planning and mapping out the basics.  By the end, you should feel comfortable and ready to get out there to start your first solo journey.  

About Our Presenter

It all started with a ship and a dream.  Erica spent her graduate school studies traveling the world aboard a ship sailing from country to country.  In the midst of those studies she embarked on many solo trips in countries like New Zealand, Tahiti, Portugal, Hong Kong and Australi.  She finished her studies in Australia but has since remained incessantly passionate about traveling and learning about other cultures.  She believes that sharing travel stories and learning from other travelers is such a gift.  She's very excited to be sharing her experiences with other New Yorkers during her workshop.  


HI New York is part of Hostelling International USA, a national nonprofit organization dedicated to inspiring a genuine understanding of people, places and cultures for a more tolerant world.  HI USA's travel education series seeks to inspire other travelers and individuals to take trips of their own and learn through the power of hostels and travel.
results.how_to_find_us: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/travel-workshop-women-traveling-solo-101-tickets-18232194986
results.name: Travel Workshop: Women Traveling Solo 101

Thursday nights are now a potluck dinner night for the Orgasmic Meditation community here in NYC! And anyone over 18 who wants to check it out too!

If you are someone who already OMs or if you are curious and want to meet the OM community and check it out, or just meet some awesome people and enjoy a warm and electric evening of connection, come join us!!

Bring an item of food if you desire, and we will provide some extra food too so don't worry about it if you can't or don't have time. 

It's a casual atmosphere that might include some connection games. It's a great way to introduce friends to the concept of OM and the community itself since there will be lots of people there with years of experience in the practice. 

OMing will not take place AT the event but for those trained in the art there will be a circle beforehand at the usual time. The event is free! 

The door will open at 7:30 sharp and we will go until about 9:30. You're welcome to come anytime in between, unlike our other events which have tighter time tables. BUT we can't guarantee there will be any food left and you might miss some fun so try to come on time!

If you have any questions please contact Marissa Ward -[masked] / [masked]

results.description:
If you're Canadian, you may already know that Crokinole is one of our nation's oldest (but also least known) games.

If you don't know the game, then you've been missing out! And it's not too late for you. Crokinole is one of the easiest dexterity games to learn.

It's like a combination of shuffleboard, curling, and billiards - played on a small table-top board. You flick small discs with the aim of knocking off your opponent's pieces and placing yours in good scoring (or snookering) positions.

It's jolly fun and social. We play every week in a great Greenpoint bistro (Milk and Roses). We have the back of the place reserved specifically for us, every Thursday night from 7pm-11:30pm.


Feel free to come anytime. Jump in a game. Watch if you prefer. Drink and food specials for all players ($8 burgers and pasta; $3 beers).

We'll have several boards out (depending on the number of RSVPs).

Good music too, including live piano for a couple of hours (9-11pm).

If you RSVP 'yes,' please make sure you come or change your RSVP to 'no' if your plans change. I bring boards from home, based on the number of people down to play. And as you may know, they're not light. Hence, the importance to me of following through with your RSVP...


Thanks and hope to see you there!
results.name: Crokinole Nights

venue.name: Arielle's Apartment (address to be emailed the day before the meetup)

results.description:
This book breaks our tradition slightly. It's not an award winner (yet!) or a best seller (yet!), but it has made a tremendous splash on the literary scene for a local writer. A mere month after the novel's release came this announcement:"Tony Award-winning actress Anika Noni Rose has optioned TV/film rights to Daniel José Older’s urban fantasy series Bone Street Rumba. http://deadline.com/2015/01/anika-noni-rose-bone-street-rumba-1201353922/

From Goodreads:
Carlos Delacruz is one of the New York Council of the Dead’s most unusual agents—an inbetweener, partially resurrected from a death he barely recalls suffering, after a life that’s missing from his memory. He thinks he is one of a kind—until he encounters other entities walking the fine line between life and death. 
One inbetweener is a sorcerer. He’s summoned a horde of implike ngks capable of eliminating spirits, and they’re spreading through the city like a plague. They’ve already taken out some of NYCOD’s finest, leaving Carlos desperate to stop their master before he opens up the entrada to the Underworld—which would destroy the balance between the living and the dead.
But in uncovering this man’s identity, Carlos confronts the truth of his own life—and death…

Some questions to keep in mind as you're reading:

• Older is playing with multiple literary traditions: urban fantasy, horror, noir. How sucessfully do you feel these traditions blend in this novel? How have each of these traditions been subverted to serve Older's purposes?

• Carlos could be said to be a flawed main character, yet generally likeable. What makes him an engaging character to tell this particular story? Were you frustrated by anything he did? What were is flaws, and how did they enhance or impede the story?

• While some books, specifically urban fantasy books, either keep their settings vague or take license with their "real-world" settings, Half-Resurrection Blues takes full advantage of a very specific setting, the neighborhoods around Prospect Park in Brooklyn, to infuse the work with hyper-real detail. Does this enhance or detract from the work for readers who do not know the setting? Does the detail anchor the book in time? Is that good or bad?

• What statements is the book making about race and culture in present-day Brooklyn? 

• Older posits a world of the dead existing paralell to our own. How well do you think that premise is handled? 

A great interview about the book:

http://therumpus.net/2015/05/the-rumpus-interview-with-daniel-jose-older/

See you in September!
results.name: Book Discussion: Half-Resurrection Blues by Daniel Jose Older

results.description:
Jazz Lovers:

If this jazz meetup has a minor theme it might be "latin" jazz;  there is so much good latin jazz everywhere we turn that we have to enjoy it, and it is, indeed, a major theme in the jazzworld and no longer the "spanish tinge" that Jelly Roll Morton famously recognized in the gumbo of early 20th century New Orleans.

But it ain't just "latin" jazz because, of course, the latino world encompasses many distinct cultures and musical styles, as exemplified by the Panamanian musicians performing at Lincoln Center.  And if you say:  "there is jazz from Panama?" consider the great Danilo Perez and, historically, the one-in-a-million Eric Dolphy, both of whom are from Panama.

So check out the website and search youtube for clips of the scheduled musicians and I'll see you there.


And if you were wondering, it is a FREEEEEEE concert.

http://www.lincolncenter.org/show/the-panama-jazz-connection
results.name: Jazz from Panama at Lincoln Center

group.name: Free Live Jazz in New York City

results.description:
Join us as we discuss Emma Donoghue's best selling novel "Room"


Publisher Weekly Review: At the start of Donoghue's powerful new novel, narrator Jack and his mother, who was kidnapped seven years earlier when she was a 19-year-old college student, celebrate his fifth birthday. They live in a tiny, 11-foot-square soundproofed cell in a converted shed in the kidnapper's yard. The sociopath, whom Jack has dubbed Old Nick, visits at night, grudgingly doling out food and supplies. Seen entirely through Jack's eyes and childlike perceptions, the developments in this novel-there are enough plot twists to provide a dramatic arc of breathtaking suspense-are astonishing. Ma, as Jack calls her, proves to be resilient and resourceful, creating exercise games, makeshift toys, and reading and math lessons to fill their days.


Room has been made into a major motion picture that will be in theaters this coming October.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BkTqhVIYbZQ

Novels at Night is  a book club for adults 21 years and older who enjoy reading and sharing their opinions about books. Join us monthly at the 9 Iron Grille (314 Paramus Road) to meet new people, sample great food** and drinks, and discuss books in a relaxed atmosphere. 


Copies of this novel can be picked up at the Paramus Public Library (116 East Century Road). Please feel free to call the library with any questions about this program, (201) 599-1305.

results.description:
A group of professional designers, programmers and bloggers meets in Fair Lawn monthly. Come to a meeting and help shape the discussion. There's room for all interests and levels of web, design or technology involvement. Discussions take on shape according to who shows up any particular month. We meet at Panera Bread to take advantage of the free Wifi and the great onion soup! Bring your iphone or laptop and feel free to bring a friend!

Looking forward to seeing you at a meeting soon!

Kimi Wei thewei.com
Contact me via Meetup organizer link.

Meeting Attendance Fees No fee for web and technology professionals. Individuals NOT web or technology professionals pay an attendance fee of $10. FAQ about this policy. Employment agents and direct employers:
Company agents looking to hire and headhunters may attend a meeting for up to 30 minutes without paying a fee. This should give you time to assess member's interest in networking with you and to hand out cards. If you would like to make a presentation or sponsor the group for a meeting or series of meetings please contact me. New or existing company looking for freelancers or wanting site critiques
For a $50 fee you may attend a meeting and interact casually with group members for about an hour, but you may not solicit targeted advice about your project or website at that meeting. If you want the group to provide a site critique, or you need help with solutions for your site/project please contact me to set up a brainstorming session. Cost will be discussed at that time.

results.description:
Please read this completely. We will be reading from Ascended Master written material for five Minutes or so and then practicing some simple Meditation Techniques of the Ascended Masters such as the I AM Decrees, Visualizations of the Golden Heart flame and the Violet Consuming flame of forgiveness and more... There will also be Plenty of time for discussion and Questions and Answers. This Meditation Practice will be Guided with also some time for Silence practice. It will be for about 15-20 minutes. We will be having this Group every month. Practicing in a group is know to greatly enhance our Spiritual experience so please join us and see. We ask that everyone practice silence about their personal spiritual experiences at the meetup group and only speak in a very general and light way, like this worked for me or I felt Joy or love etc. without going into details. This will make for a more equality consciousness in the group with out people standing out as being more spiritually Conscious then others.. it is not the purpose of this group to talk about our personal Spiritual experiences but to learn the teachings and techniques to have our own Spiritual experiences and awakening, that is our focus.

Look forward to seeing you all then.

Peace & Blessings

Mindy & Anthony

results.description:
Open to All. Thursday nights are now a potluck dinner night for the Orgasmic Meditation community here in NYC! And anyone over 18 who wants to check it out too!

If you are someone who already OMs or if you are curious and want to meet the OM community and check it out, or just meet some awesome people and enjoy a warm and electric evening of connection, come join us!!

Bring an item of food if you desire, and we will provide some extra food too so don't worry about it if you can't or don't have time. It's a casual atmosphere that might include some connection games. It's a great way to introduce friends to the concept of OM and the community itself since there will be lots of people there with years of experience in the practice. OMing will not take place AT the event but for those trained in the art there will be a circle beforehand at the usual time. The event is free! The door will open at 7:30 sharp and we will go until about 9:30. You're welcome to come anytime in between, unlike our other events which have tighter time tables. BUT we can't guarantee there will be any food left and you might miss some fun so try to come on time! If you have any questions please contact Marissa Ward -[masked] / [masked] Can't make it to this event? check out www.turnonny.us for more.

YMCA Members must show thier membership card, This Meet Up is available to YMCA members only- Sorry!

Club / High school Varsity level of play or better. NO BEGINNERS PLEASE!!! 

Please bring a white shirt and a dark shirt.

Soccer field is just beyond the main entrance.

If your not a YMCA member, you can still come down for an evening to see if your interested in playing with us regularly. Go online to the YMCA site, get a one time free pass for the evening. You can also call the Y on 15th street and ask for a free pass.  www.ymcanyc.org

The Y is a non-profit!!! That means they offer financial aid if you can't afford the membership! You need to inquire in person at the Y!

    This meet up is every Thursday at the Y from 8:00pm to 10:30pm. if your bringing a friend or friends they must be YMCA members and please make sure you RSVP for them also.  Space is limited to 16 players total!

NOTE:  NO -SHOWS!  If YOU RSVP AND THEN NOT SHOW UP ( TWICE ) YOU WILL BE REMOVED FROM THE GROUP!

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Pablo G.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Pablo G.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

results.description:
“3 And I set my face unto the Lord God, to seek by prayer and supplications, with fasting, and sackcloth, and ashes: 4 And I prayed unto the LORD my God, and made my confession , and said , O Lord, the great and dreadful God, keeping the covenant and mercy to them that love him, and to them that keep his commandment; “ (Daniel 9:3-4; KJV)

Please join us for “Prayer for our Nation,” hosted monthly by The Daniel Team, the Prayer Ministry of the Christian Party of America. The “Prayer for our Nation” conference call is the second Thursday of every month at 8:30 PM eastern (7:30 central).  The Daniel Team is led by Luis Chiang.   You do not need to be a member of the Christian Party to participate in the prayer conference calls or the other monthly conference calls for the Christian Party.   If you would like to become a member of the Daniel Team, please send an email to [masked] requesting to join the prayer ministry.  Thank you.

For more information about the Christian Party of America, go to www.ChristianPartyonline.com.  And Please like us on Facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Christian-Party-of-America/198905400159491

Prayer Objectives:

1.  True repentance, in the hearts of our citizens, which manifests itself in our daily lives.

2.  The healing and restoration of families in America.

3.  The restoration of Biblical principles employed in the ruling of our nation from the local to the national level.

4.  To teach the Church to maintain this righteous life so that once America is restored we will continue to teach the Body (including our children) to maintain godliness in our personal and public lives.

Prayer Strategies:

1.  We need to search our hearts and ask the Lord to reveal to us any sins that may be preventing Him from fully answering our prayers. (Joshua 7:10)  Once revealed, we need to confess our sins to Him (and repent of them) and, if appropriate, to those whom we offended.

2.  We need to assume the sins of the nation on ourselves; just as Daniel did for the sins of the nation of Israel (Daniel 9).

3.  It is absolutely crucial that in all these endeavors that prayer be our primary focus.  We need to rely on prayer (Jesus) as the foundation for everything that we do.  In addition, prayer teams need to be set up that will pray before, during, and after all events, etc. in order to bath in prayer everything that we do.  These prayer teams will be the “heavy lifters” who will be moving heaven and earth for us as we fight to regain our nation.

4.  We should follow (among other prayers in the Word), the prayers of repentance and requests for restoration that we find in the Bible, as we pray for our nation.

Prayer Focus:

1.  Jesus is the only way and the only power that will enable our nation to turn around (2 Cor 7:14). We need to focus on Him and to trust in Him alone, as we confess and turn from our sins; that He will tear down the strongholds of the enemy in our nation and in our individual lives. “When the enemy comes in; like a flood the Spirit of the Lord will lift up a standard against him.” (Isa 59:19). We must not trust in any tactic, procedure, or whatever in order to overcome the devil (who is behind all of the evil that we see around us). “For our struggle is not against flesh and blood, but against the rulers, against the authorities, against the powers of this dark world and against the spiritual forces of evil in the heavenly realms.” Ephesians 6:11-13

2.  We need to ensure that we stay focused.  The enemy (Satan) will try different tactics against us, e.g., to get our focus off of that which is most important and to either divert our attention on that which is least important and/or try to get us to do too much.  He will probably try to bring division amongst us.  My guess is that it would be through misunderstandings, hurt feelings, etc.  We must be aware of this up-front, expecting the attacks and to realize that the attacks are coming from the enemy and not from what we can, e.g., see with our natural eyes.

Prayer Tactics:

1.  We need to find appropriate Scriptures to stand upon to bring before the Lord as we pray individually and corporately.  It is crucial that we not follow a hard fast cook book approach; even one that is based on the Bible.  We need to know what the Scriptures say and then to allow the Holy Spirit to use what He’s taught us to do or to pray those things that He brings to mind or puts into our hearts to do.  For example, don’t have the “Hail Mary” prayer approach, e.g., I always have to pray this way or to pray these prayers in this exact order.

2.  The Church needs to be actively involved in politics and other social endeavors such as education, health care, the legal system, etc. (if even just knowing what is going on). In politics, the Body should then intelligently and with Christ-like love contact their representatives making their viewpoints known.  These godly leaders need to then rally the Body perhaps at local auditoriums, stadiums, etc. in order show the Church the truth about how our nation began and how the Church was actively involved in all facets of social life for the first few hundred years of our pre- and post-national existence.  The Body needs to learn that we must stand on what God’s Word says and to fight for what’s ours (just as the Israelites entered the Promised Land, fought huge giants, and won). 

Finally, remember:

2 Chron 16:9 “For the eyes of the Lord range throughout the earth to strengthen those whose hearts are fully committed to him…”

PREPARATION FOR PRAYER-STUDY MATERIALS

Repentance from Idolatry

All the sins described below are the symptoms of a bigger sickness, which is denying God as our creator and not glorifying him and acknowledging him as the supreme ruler of the universe. Rom 1:29 states “All Unrighteousness” stems out from the root of idolatry (Rom1:23). So, fornication is not a sickness, it is one of the symptoms of idolatry, covetousness is not a sickness, it is another symptom of idolatry, etc.

It is very important to focus our prayer efforts on this first cause of sin, which is ignoring God, suppressing the truth, and replacing the Creator by the created. God and truth are self-evident, but we choose to rebel against it. What we need is to repent from that.

Studying the nature of repentance would help tremendously in our efforts to pray and intercede for people because repentance is the key to come back to God and be healed.

Rom 1:18  For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who hold the truth in unrighteousness;

Rom 1:19  Because that which may be known of God is manifest in them; for God hath shewed it unto them.

Rom 1:20  For the invisible things of him from the creation of the world are clearly seen, being understood by the things that are made, even his eternal power and Godhead; so that they are without excuse:

Rom 1:21  Because that, when they knew God, they glorified him not as God, neither were thankful; but became vain in their imaginations, and their foolish heart was darkened.

Rom 1:22  Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools,

Rom 1:23  And changed the glory of the incorruptible God into an image made like to corruptible man, and to birds, and four-footed beasts, and creeping things.

Rom 1:24  Wherefore God also gave them up to uncleanness through the lusts of their own hearts, to dishonour their own bodies between themselves:

Rom 1:25  Who changed the truth of God into a lie, and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator, who is blessed forever. Amen.

Rom 1:26  For this cause God gave them up unto vile affections: for even their women did change the natural use into that which is against nature:

Rom 1:27  And likewise also the men, leaving the natural use of the woman, burned in their lust one toward another; men with men working that which is unseemly, and receiving in themselves that recompence of their error which was meet.

Rom 1:28  And even as they did not like to retain God in their knowledge, God gave them over to a reprobate mind, to do those things which are not convenient;

Rom 1:29  Being filled with all unrighteousness, fornication, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, debate, deceit, malignity; whisperers,

Rom 1:30  Backbiters, haters of God, despiteful, proud, boasters, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,

Rom 1:31  Without understanding, covenant breakers, without natural affection, implacable, unmerciful:

Rom 1:32  Who knowing the judgment of God, that they which commit such things are worthy of death, not only do the same, but have pleasure in them that do them.

Here’s an example of what causes repentance:

Let’s pray that America focus on the much that we have, so our hearts is filled with thanksgiving for his goodness towards us, and our hearts lead us to repentance.

Rom_2:4  Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering; not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance?

Let’s pray that the end result of America’s tribulations, the recession, the aging and health deterioration of Americans, the financial distress, etc. work for our good, changing our hearts and drawing closer to God.

2Co_7:10  For godly sorrow worketh repentance to salvation not to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death.

Let’s pray that America realize that God wants every American to be saved and not face judgment. Let’s pray that our pastors emphasize the human responsibility in determining our final destiny

2Pe_3:9  The Lord is not slack concerning his promise, as some men count slackness; but is longsuffering to us-ward, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance.

Other observations on the word Repentance

The word repentance is used in connection with God, as well as with man. When it is used in connection with God, it is usually positive. God never repents to do good for his people. God repents himself from exercising judgment and punishment on his people.

Let’s pray that God will change his mind executing the punishment that we deserve.

Num_23:19  God is not a man, that he should lie; neither the son of man, that he should repent: hath he said, and shall he not do it? or hath he spoken, and shall he not make it good?

1Sa_15:29  And also the Strength of Israel will not lie nor repent: for he is not a man, that he should repent.

Psa_110:4  The LORD hath sworn, and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.

Psa_135:14  For the LORD will judge his people, and he will repent himself concerning his servants.

Jer_18:8  If that nation, against whom I have pronounced, turn from their evil, I will repent of the evil that I thought to do unto them.

Satan is the God of this world. He endows his faithful servants with power to promote sin from the top down. In that sense, it is very important to know that sin is not based on grass root strategies; it is a highly organized well-funded push strategy.

Blindness comes from Satan.

Let’s pray in the Name of Jesus and bind Satan’s power, rebuke his authority, and order him to take away his hands off America. Let’s pray that the spiritual veil be torn and people be able to see what’s evident.

2Co_4:4  In whom the god of this world hath blinded the minds of them which believe not, lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine unto them.

Joh 12:40  He hath blinded their eyes, and hardened their heart; that they should not see with their eyes, nor understand with their heart, and be converted, and I should heal them.

The realization of our sinful nature comes when we get in contact with God the Holy Spirit, and his different manifestations. In that sense, we are also empowered to expose sin because the Holy Spirit dwells in us and we can testify of him through our actions.

Let’s pray that God produces growth in us, and the works of faith that glorify Him “in us” serve as testimony that he lives. Let’s pray that the Holy Spirit be poured over America, so people be able to experience his conviction and turn away from idolatry.

Joh 16:8  And when he is come, he will reprove the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:

Isa 6:5  Then said I, Woe is me! for I am undone; because I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips: for mine eyes have seen the King, the LORD of hosts.

Luk 5:8  When Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus' knees, saying, Depart from me; for I am a sinful man, O Lord.

Let’s pray that we Christians devote our time reading the Word of God, so he continues the process of sanctification and purification. Let’s pray for zeal for his word, and that God appoints servants with the task of preserving the word of truth so the undiluted message is extended to the next generation.

Joh 17:17  Sanctify them through thy truth: thy word is truth.

The realization of our sinful nature comes when we get in contact with God the Holy Spirit, and his different manifestations. In that sense, we are also empowered to expose sin because the Holy Spirit dwells in us and we can testify of him through our actions.

Let’s pray that God produces growth in us, and the works of faith that glorify Him “in us” serve as testimony that he lives. Let’s pray that the Holy Spirit be poured over America, so people be able to experience his conviction and turn away from idolatry.

Joh 16:8  And when he is come, he will reprove the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:

Isa 6:5  Then said I, Woe is me! for I am undone; because I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips: for mine eyes have seen the King, the LORD of hosts.

Luk 5:8  When Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus' knees, saying, Depart from me; for I am a sinful man, O Lord.

Let’s pray that we Christians devote our time reading the Word of God, so he continues the process of sanctification and purification. Let’s pray for zeal for his word, and that God appoints servants with the task of preserving the word of truth so the undiluted message is extended to the next generation.

Joh 17:17  Sanctify them through thy truth: thy word is truth.

Excerpts from the Book of Daniel (Chapter 9):

 “…3 So I turned to the Lord God and pleaded with him in prayer and petition, in fasting, and in sackcloth and ashes.

4 I prayed to the LORD my God and confessed:

“Lord, the great and awesome God, who keeps his covenant of love with those who love him and keep his commandments, 5 we have sinned and done wrong. We have been wicked and have rebelled; we have turned away from your commands and laws. 6 We have not listened to your servants the prophets, who spoke in your name to our kings, our princes and our ancestors, and to all the people of the land.

7 “Lord, you are righteous, but this day we are covered with shame—the people of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem and all Israel, both near and far, in all the countries where you have scattered us because of our unfaithfulness to you. 8 We and our kings, our princes and our ancestors are covered with shame, LORD, because we have sinned against you. 9 The Lord our God is merciful and forgiving, even though we have rebelled against him; 10 we have not obeyed the LORD our God or kept the laws he gave us through his servants the prophets. 11 All Israel has transgressed your law and turned away, refusing to obey you.

“Therefore the curses and sworn judgments written in the Law of Moses, the servant of God, have been poured out on us, because we have sinned against you. 12 You have fulfilled the words spoken against us and against our rulers by bringing on us great disaster. Under the whole heaven nothing has ever been done like what has been done to Jerusalem. 13 Just as it is written in the Law of Moses, all this disaster has come on us, yet we have not sought the favor of the LORD our God by turning from our sins and giving attention to your truth. 14 The LORD did not hesitate to bring the disaster on us, for the LORD our God is righteous in everything he does; yet we have not obeyed him.

15 “Now, Lord our God, who brought your people out of Egypt with a mighty hand and who made for yourself a name that endures to this day, we have sinned, we have done wrong. 16 Lord, in keeping with all your righteous acts, turn away your anger and your wrath from Jerusalem, your city, your holy hill. Our sins and the iniquities of our ancestors have made Jerusalem (America) and your people an object of scorn to all those around us.

17 “Now, our God, hear the prayers and petitions of your servant. For your sake, Lord, look with favor on your desolate sanctuary. 18 Give ear, our God, and hear; open your eyes and see the desolation of the city that bears your Name. We do not make requests of you because we are righteous, but because of your great mercy. 19 Lord, listen! Lord, forgive! Lord, hear and act! For your sake, my God, do not delay, because your city and your people bear your Name. ”

Excerpts from the Book of Ezra (Chapter 9):

After these things had been done, the leaders came to me and said, “The people of Israel, including the priests and the Levites, have not kept themselves separate from the neighboring peoples with their detestable practices, like those of the Canaanites, Hittites, Perizzites, Jebusites, Ammonites, Moabites, Egyptians and Amorites. 2 They have taken some of their daughters as wives for themselves and their sons, and have mingled the holy race with the peoples around them. And the leaders and officials have led the way in this unfaithfulness.”

3 When I heard this, I tore my tunic and cloak, pulled hair from my head and beard and sat down appalled. 4 Then everyone who trembled at the words of the God of Israel gathered around me because of this unfaithfulness of the exiles. And I sat there appalled until the evening sacrifice.

5 Then, at the evening sacrifice, I rose from my self-abasement, with my tunic and cloak torn, and fell on my knees with my hands spread out to the LORD my God 6 and prayed:

“I am too ashamed and disgraced, my God, to lift up my face to you, because our sins are higher than our heads and our guilt has reached to the heavens. 7 From the days of our ancestors until now, our guilt has been great. Because of our sins, we and our kings and our priests have been subjected to the sword and captivity, to pillage and humiliation at the hand of foreign kings, as it is today…

10 “But now, our God, what can we say after this? For we have forsaken the commands 11 you gave through your servants the prophets when you said: ‘The land you are entering to possess is a land polluted by the corruption of its peoples. By their detestable practices they have filled it with their impurity from one end to the other. 12 Therefore, do not give your daughters in marriage to their sons or take their daughters for your sons. Do not seek a treaty of friendship with them at any time, that you may be strong and eat the good things of the land and leave it to your children as an everlasting inheritance.’

13 “What has happened to us is a result of our evil deeds and our great guilt, and yet, our God, you have punished us less than our sins deserved and have given us a remnant like this. 14 Shall we then break your commands again and intermarry with the peoples who commit such detestable practices? Would you not be angry enough with us to destroy us, leaving us no remnant or survivor? 15 LORD, the God of Israel, you are righteous! We are left this day as a remnant. Here we are before you in our guilt, though because of it not one of us can stand in your presence.”

5.  Pray that the Lord will rise up godly pastors (or Church leaders) who will agree to work together to preach and teach on preparing the Church, e.g., to first of all pray and fast for our nation in small and large gatherings (at work during lunch hour, at home, in parks, at church, at social gatherings, etc.) around our nation; asking the Lord to have mercy on America (as we, as Christians confess our sins of idolatry, ambivalence, etc. to Him.  Also, these leaders should teach of the need for the Church to be actively involved in the world (to be the salt and the light of the world).  But, everything - absolutely everything should be focused on love; the Father’s agape love being shown to the world.  “A new command I give you: Love one another. As I have loved you, so you must love one another.  By this everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you love one another.” (John 13:[masked])

As an example of a godly leader raising the awareness of God’s people to gather together in repentance, is Ezra:

Excerpts from the Book of Ezra (Chapter 10):

“While Ezra was praying and confessing, weeping and throwing himself down before the house of God, a large crowd of Israelites—men, women and children—gathered around him. They too wept bitterly. 2 Then Shekaniah son of Jehiel, one of the descendants of Elam, said to Ezra, “We have been unfaithful to our God by marrying foreign women from the peoples around us. But in spite of this, there is still hope for Israel. 3 Now let us make a covenant before our God to send away all these women and their children, in accordance with the counsel of my lord and of those who fear the commands of our God. Let it be done according to the Law. 4 Rise up; this matter is in your hands. We will support you, so take courage and do it.”

5 So Ezra rose up and put the leading priests and Levites and all Israel under oath to do what had been suggested. And they took the oath. 6 Then Ezra withdrew from before the house of God and went to the room of Jehohanan son of Eliashib. While he was there, he ate no food and drank no water, because he continued to mourn over the unfaithfulness of the exiles.

7 A proclamation was then issued throughout Judah and Jerusalem for all the exiles to assemble in Jerusalem. 8 Anyone who failed to appear within three days would forfeit all his property, in accordance with the decision of the officials and elders, and would himself be expelled from the assembly of the exiles.

9 Within the three days, all the men of Judah and Benjamin had gathered in Jerusalem. And on the twentieth day of the ninth month, all the people were sitting in the square before the house of God, greatly distressed by the occasion and because of the rain. 10 Then Ezra the priest stood up and said to them, “You have been unfaithful; you have married foreign women, adding to Israel’s guilt. 11 Now honor[a] the LORD, the God of your ancestors, and do his will. Separate yourselves from the peoples around you and from your foreign wives.”

12 The whole assembly responded with a loud voice: “You are right! We must do as you say. 13 But there are many people here and it is the rainy season; so we cannot stand outside. Besides, this matter cannot be taken care of in a day or two, because we have sinned greatly in this thing. 14 Let our officials act for the whole assembly. Then let everyone in our towns who has married a foreign woman come at a set time, along with the elders and judges of each town, until the fierce anger of our God in this matter is turned away from us.” 15 Only Jonathan son of Asahel and Jahzeiah son of Tikvah, supported by Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite, opposed this.

16 So the exiles did as was proposed. Ezra the priest selected men who were family heads, one from each family division, and all of them designated by name. On the first day of the tenth month they sat down to investigate the cases, 17 and by the first day of the first month they finished dealing with all the men who had married foreign women.”
results.name: Prayer For Our Nation

results.description:
Thursday nights are now a potluck dinner night for the Orgasmic Meditation community here in NYC! And anyone over 18 who wants to check it out too!

If you are someone who already OMs or if you are curious and want to meet the OM community and check it out, or just meet some awesome people and enjoy a warm and electric evening of connection, come join us!!

Bring an item of food if you desire, and we will provide some extra food too so don't worry about it if you can't or don't have time. 

It's a casual atmosphere that might include some connection games. It's a great way to introduce friends to the concept of OM and the community itself since there will be lots of people there with years of experience in the practice. 

OMing will not take place AT the event but for those trained in the art there will be a circle beforehand at the usual time. The event is free! 

The door will open at 7:30 sharp and we will go until about 9:30. You're welcome to come anytime in between, unlike our other events which have tighter time tables. BUT we can't guarantee there will be any food left and you might miss some fun so try to come on time! 

If you have any questions please contact Marissa Ward -[masked] / [masked]
results.name: OM Community Potluck Night!! Open to All

(Technical Support: <a>[masked]</a>)


The Inner Engineering online program includes guided meditations, powerful breathing techniques, and deeply engaging discourses about the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life’s situations.

Inner Engineering is a combination of methods derived from the ancient science of yoga that addresses every aspect of human well-being — from your body, mind and emotions to the fundamental of life energy within. 

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru

results.description:
A Shocking and Insightful Internet Broadcast with Qesankh Maa Kheperu!

To Hear The Broadcast Go To: http://tobtr.com/7903527

To Call In with Questions: (347)[masked]

Join Qesankh Maa Kheperu on Thursday, September 10, 2015 for his exciting first ever live internet broadcast.  Master Teacher Qesankh will pull back the curtain that keeps us all in the dark, and reveal the puppet masters and their devious plan for the human race.  We all know that something is wrong with today’s world and whether we like to admit it or not, we can all sense that something dark is coming.  However, unlike what you may have heard before, this broadcast will reveal the shocking truth about this darkness.  You will hear who is in power, how they came to be so, and what their plan is for the future of humanity.  But more specifically Master Teacher Qesankh will expose the secrets behind:


·  Why there is war

·  Why there is oppression`

·  Who or what are the so-called ruling elite

·  How the ruling elite controls the planet

·  How they control the world’s wealth

·  How they have rewritten history so that we cannot remember essential parts of the past

·  What the universe really is

·  If we’ve made contact with extra terrestrials

·  If there are other dimensions

·  Why there is human suffering

·  Whether we are heading towards a high-tech peaceful future or one of extreme oppression

·  How you can communicate with those in the future and they back to you

·  If George Orwell was right about Big Brother

Of course, you are probably aware that revealing the truths of our current predicament is just one level of understanding.  In fact, many speakers use it as a scare tactic to secure engagements and sell books.  Yet these very same speakers offer no solid solutions and many times are paid to spread disinformation.  Master Teacher Qesankh will go further than other speakers by revealing specific techniques as to how you can awaken the God within to harness incredible power.  With it, we can counter the sinister plans of the elite.  Poverty, oppression, and pain can be severely reduced in our own lifetimes by this approach.  For it is only through the human race working together to achieve our full potential that we can counteract these plans for our destruction.

Join The Revolution!

The Global Conspiracy to Destroy The Human Race

Thursday, September 10, 2015, 2:00 pm

To Hear The Broadcast Go To:  http://tobtr.com/7903527

To Call In with Questions: (347)[masked]

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include...


30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

This event is officially hosted by The Rise, NYC. They host morning workouts every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday mornings. See them on meetup here:


http://www.meetup.com/The-Rise-NYC/


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Challenge with The Rise

100% of the proceeds from this event will go to charity. The primary charity will be Team Red, White & Blue.

results.description:
Hello Friends!

This week, we'll be chatting with Karin Bellantoni. Karin is a katalyst for change and is an experienced entrepreneur who’s first company became a multi-million dollar business with 18 employees in less than 2 years. She works closely with company founders and business leaders to increase profits via a holistic, 360-degree approach for over 20 years. Experienced at rapid growth and the sale of her own start-up, Karin’s approach develops a strong foundation for a company's infrastructure. Her clients often refer to her as a “game-changer” and call on her to optimize operations, sales, and egos during times of explosive growth and uncertainty. She is a mentor at the Startup Institute and has worked with founders at leading startups. Karin is passionate about supporting entrepreneurial women on whatever their current adventure is!

We'll get a chance to hear her journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Not to mention good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay cool and classy... See you this Friday!
results.name: Founder's Friday with Karin Bellantoni

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!

results.description:
It's graduation day for the Greenback cohort.  Come celebrate with us as Eddy and Adam present their final project MoneyMusic and mingle with Byte Academy students, staff, FinTech and Byte community members.  Light refreshments will be served.


About MoneyMusic

MoneyMusic is a music sharing and social networking app built on top of a proprietary music recommendation algorithm.  With the help of the Spotify API, users are able to sync their Spotify libraries and receive playlists built by MoneyMusic's playlist generation algorithm.  These playlists can be 'liked' or 'disliked' which teaches the algorithm about the users tastes.  The more a user 'likes'/'dislikes' playlists, the more educated the algorithm will become.  Users can even save the playlists we serve them directly to their Spotify accounts. 

There is a social network aspect as well that allows users to follow other users.  Each user has a mini-feed on their timeline that allows them to see recent activity of the users whom they follow.  If a user likes a particular song in their minifeed, they have the option to save the individual song to their Spotify account as well.

results.description:
Did you say that you are an Adventurer?

 Do you love the thrill of travel to places you have never been, exploring new worlds, the search for New Adventure/Hiking, Camping, Kayaking?

  Staying in a cabin on a Beautiful Lake!

When are you going on your next adventure? 

How about right now!


Price: $130.00 for 2 Nights lodging and $50.00 for round trip transportation from Manhattan to Vermont.


VERMONT WILDERNESS ADVENTURE WEEKEND !!!

THIS IS A ONCE IN A LIFETIME ADVENTURE! DONT MISS IT  

We will stay in a cabin, on a lake, near the majestic Green Mountains of Vermont!

There is also a hidden secret here.

We are staying at a REAL GOLD MINE ! YES we will bring take 24 karat gold out of the mine, free.

We are looking for a FEW GOOD MEN AND WOMEN!  We will be hiking down a ravine to a beautiful OASIS in the middle of the enchanted Vermont Forest setting up camp near a waterfall in the majestically carved out bedrock in Plymouth Vermont!

This is your chance to kayak pristine mountain wilderness lakes, hike Vermont's unspoiled beauty of the green mountains,. This is a  REAL ADVENTURE TRIP so were going all out for this one. We will stay a CABIN ON A LAKE (with Clean Beds and A Clean Hot, Shower) for the weekend (There will be two in a room).

AGENDA. 

Friday 5pm leave for Vermont.   Arrive around 10pm.  Then a bbq party till 12 midnight, then, midnight swimming in the lake.

Saturday morning, wake up and have a BIG Vermont Country breakfast at small town restaurant and then go out to the Majestic Mountain Lake to Kaya, Canoe or paddle boat for a few hours with the Scenic Green Mountain Landscape as your Photographic Canvas.

After a good workout on the river we will head to a local restaurant for lunch, on our way to hike a 3,000 foot peak, in search for Moose, Bear, Wildcat, Coyote and other Wild animals.

On the way home, stopping by a local Gastro Pub/Brewery for High quality food and drinks, we will get some supplies for our midnight bbq and midnight swim in the Mountain Lake.

FEES.


LODGING  $130.00    TRANSPORTATION  $50.00

What do you get for $[masked]?  Well I am glad you asked!

The Absolute thrill of a life time, memories you will never forget! 

Equipment Needed.

Cold Weather Clothing.  We will be in the Mountains in Vermont.  Backpack, Headlamp ( For night hiking and adventuring!) hiking boots.

Hiking Waterfall Trails

You must pay for your space in the cottage when you RSVP.

Fall Hiking with the Moose, Deer, Bobcat and Beautiful Vermont Landscape

at  your Front Door!

When are you going on your next adventure? How about right now!

George, Organizer, Fit and Fun

results.description:
Weather: Hello Guys and Gals! Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.
Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.

Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.
