results.description:
We've visited this museum several times in the past, and it's definitely been a good experience each time. You get a wide experience here- from the traditional eastern religions and philosophies to a modern sense of spirtuality and perception, and also a perfect blend of the two together. That sound snooty enough for you? All that aside, they have beautiful collections here, both ancient and modern art. Plus they have a trendy lounge with food, drinks, and a DJ. And you know what else? It's free- Yep, free, every Friday night from 6-10pm. You can't beat that- get some culture, get some food, and maybe get some groovin' to the music. For an added bonus, there's a happy hour from 6-7pm, 2-for-1 drink specials. They even allow us into the downstairs gallery while still enjoying our drinks. I don't know about you, but art appreciation seems a little easier with a drink in your hand.

For those of you that won't be able to make it at 6pm, that's fine. The museum has a fairly simple layout and it shouldn't be too dificult to meet up when you get there.

So the plan is: arrive when you can, enjoy the happy hour if you get there before it ends, check out some really interesting art, and do all that while getting to know some good people. Sounds like a great plan to me.

A little about the Museum from their website: The Rubin Museum of Art is home to a comprehensive collection of art from the Himalayas and surrounding regions. The artistic heritage of this vast and culturally varied area of the world remains relatively obscure. Through changing exhibitions and an array of engaging public programs, the museum offers opportunities to explore the artistic legacy of the Himalayan region and to appreciate its place in the context of world cultures.

The museum's collection consists of paintings, sculptures, and textiles. Although works of art range in date over two millennia, most reflect major periods and schools of Himalayan art from the twelfth century onward.

The exhibitions are organized with particular care to assist viewers who are new to Himalayan art. Wall texts and interpretive panels supply aesthetic, social, and historical perspectives to both scholars and casual viewers. The Explore Art Galleries on the third and fifth floors (with a video alcove on the sixth floor) take the viewer behind the scenes, answering questions about why and for whom the art was made. Books, paintings, photographs, artifacts, and computer terminals accessing the museum's website and affiliated sites offer other examples of Himalayan and related art.
results.name: The Rubin Museum of Art

group.name: I wanted to do that...Just not alone!!

results.description:
Join us in North Chelsea at Pushcart Coffee for knitting, crocheting, good pastries, great coffee and craft beer. Soft instruction for beginner knitters will be offered by Janna. So, if you're a newbie Janna will be happy to introduce you to the basics or make you more comfortable with what you already know.

Be sure to let Janna know you want instruction, since many people come just hang out and knit. Feel free to come with any other craft too.

For those of you who would like knitting instruction, Janna will bring some supplies to use upon request, but if you want to bring your project home you have two options:

1) We can get supplies for you!  For a small fee (around $15), Janna will pick up for needles and yarn for you to keep.  Please post on the discussion board if you would like Janna to get materials for you.

2) You are welcome to bring your own materials. Feel free to ask me questions about what supplies to bring by commenting below or messaging Janna Maria Vallee.

Pushcart Coffee closes at 8:30pm

We would love to see/support your progress at other meetups throughout the month!
results.name: Knitting at Pushcart Coffee with free beginner knitting instruction from Janna

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP ON DHARMA DRINK MEETUP PAGE (www.dharmadrink.com - thank you!)

 

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

Meeting monthly at the Rubin during the summer - but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as the come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist  hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more, the merrier.

Time:  6-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

 

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists and like minded people

results.description:
What day is today? Why, it's bring the pain Friday! It is once again time for us to ... Dodge. The. Ball.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of dodgeball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game in which players on two teams throw large balls at each other while avoiding being hit themselves. That's it. And no athletic skill is necessary!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using with a few modifications: Dodgeball Rules

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be dodging and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.
results.name: Urban Athletics: Dodgeball for Grownups (Co-ed)

results.description:
Healing is still happening in NYC. I need healing too on this day. I want to give out as many silent hugs as possible this day. Join me. I need you. The city needs you. Humanity needs you.

Location is meeting at the City Hall Park Fountain (see map here) We will meet at the fountain and make any needed signs. I will bring blanks and markers. Feel free to premake a sign. We will make brand new signs for this very special event. I will only be bringing blanks. Then we will explore the area and see where the crowds are. If you have not joined us before please check out the video below to see what we do. We hope to see you there.

This will be a more solemn occasion so we need to react with the crowds. Some people may not know how to feel and we need to respect whatever response to us they have. I would think this is more of a hugging day than a high five day. So the general idea of how the evening goes:

6pm - 7pm meet up at the park make new signs (bring supplies if you have some to share)

7pm - 9pm - We walk and find the crowds. Hand out high fives/hugs/love! Here's an awesome video of what we do. http://newyorknatives.com/lets-meet-up-and-hug-and-high-five/

results.description: Sept. 11, Chomp Chomp: Sophisticated New York gastronomes, hear this: you don’t know it all. There’s a whole culture of hawker food that is sold in large, open-air malls in Singapore called hawker centers. Very little of this will be recognizable to a Western palate: Hainanese chicken rice, Hokkien noodles, grilled skate, lamb curry, carrot cake (which is neither carrot nor cake!), oyster omelet, things smothered in shrimp paste and lots more cheap, classic street food. It’s all to be found at a new restaurant from chef Simpson Wong, Chomp Chomp, 7 Cornelia St. [masked]), which scored a review in the Aug. 3 New Yorker. Sylvia Killingsworth says Wong’s goal is “less to intimidate you with spice than to woo you with depth of flavor. The eclectic assortment of dishes has influences from China, India, Indonesia and Malaysia.” We are nothing if not eclectic, and Allen Chan, Fast and Fab’s own transplanted Singaporean, guides us through the hawker menu. Meet at the restaurant at 6 on the evening in question; a viewing of “Shaun the Sheep” later the same evening is not out of the question. Discussion of next summer's trip to Italy is high on the agenda. Bob Nelson, fastnfab (at) yahoo (dot) com or[masked]-7160.
results.name: CHOMP CHOMP!

results.description:
**** Multi-Meetup Event ****


What day is today? Why, it's bring the pain Friday! It is once again time for us to ... Dodge. The. Ball.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of dodgeball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game in which players on two teams throw large balls at each other while avoiding being hit themselves. That's it. And no athletic skill is necessary!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using with a few modifications: Dodgeball Rules

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be dodging and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.
results.name: Urban Athletics: Dodgeball for Grownups (Co-ed)

results.description:
Summer isn't technically over until September 23, which means we have time for one last big gay BBQ!

Our friends at Pop Bar (home of Astoria's best back patio!) will be hosting our next mixer on Friday September 11. We'll start up at 6pm and continue on through happy hour, leaving you all there to experience the launch of their new LGBT Friday night party, replete with DJs and dancers.

BUT WAIT THERE'S SO MUCH MORE! We have board elections coming up later this year and we'd like to give everyone the opportunity to either become a voting dues-paying member or to renew their current membership for another year (this allows you to run/vote in our elections and covers administrative costs for web presence, BBQ groceries, etc.)

So, here's the deal: there will be a $10 wristband charge for unlimited BBQ goodness (and let's face it, where can you dine in Astoria for less?), and this fee will also go to making you an official member of Out Astoria. What a nice package! See you there! (If you've never been to Pop Bar it's just a block or two west of 21st Street, walking either from the 30th Avenue or Astoria Blvd stops.)

results.description:
Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

We mostly play newer "euro" style board games (Ticket to Ride and Settlers of Catan are among the oldest) that often run 1.5 to 3.0 hours. If you arrive while games are going on, prepare to hang out and chat while they finish up then organize for a new game.

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.


Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

Note, we will be sharing a hotel bathroom key, so please do not return it to the bar until the evening is over.

Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Studies indicate that practicing LKM positively impacts our emotions, our physical health, and our sense of connection. Our weekly Metta Meditation Group meets for practice and discussion every week with IDP's Executive Director, Kimberly Brown. 

This offering is open to both beginners and experienced meditators. Cushions and chairs will be provided. We request a $10-$20 donation to support our organization, though no one will be turned away for lack of funds.

Note we are located on the 2nd floor of a walk-up building. There is no elevator.


The Interdependence Project

Between Houston and 1st Street

results.description:
Words are from Viviana Bruno the Host for this event

"For those of you that don't know, I am a 9/11 survivor. I was in the North Tower of the World Trade Center when American Airlines Flight 11 was hijacked and crashed into the building. I'm often asked, "What do you do on the anniversary?" And my response is always, "Every year I do something different!" This year I'm opting to do my "long Saturday run" on Friday night and I'm opting to run by the Freedom Tower in honor of celebrating what I call is my unofficial second birthday. What an exciting way to celebrate our freedom!

I figured I'd extend this invitation to the group. It's a great opportunity for those of us that are training for the NYC marathon and are running the 5th Ave Mile on Sunday 9/13.

Friday Night - 15 flat easy miles
Saturday - REST
Sunday - Run our fastest Mile (5th Ave Mile) Meeting location: Madison Square Park (23rd Street and Madison Avenue) Running Across 23rd Street to the East Side and running south along East River Park and hopping on Westside Highway up to 125th Street. Going across 125th Street to Broadway and down to 110th Street and ending at 110th Street near Adam Clayton entrance to Central Park. (approximately 15 miles)

All paces welcomed, but I will mention that I run SEXY pace! Looking forward to what will hopefully be a cool Friday night fun run by the water!"
results.name: Long Training Run on 9/11 Anniversary

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!

results.description:
Join us for the next Startup Weekend, Global Fashion Battle! This event will focus around fashion technology. What is fashion technology? In a broad sense, it’s when fashion (what we wear, what we aspire to be, how we present ourselves to society through clothing) meets technology (innovation, a digital presence, engaging online & mobile content.) It’s fashion embracing a new and digital component to sell / present their business model. It’s where technology and fashion have merged to create faster and more innovative ways to shop, market, educate and ultimately experience the fashion industry whether through software, apps or products. From e-commerce to 3D printing to wearables, fashion technology covers a wide spectrum of applicable use cases.

Why attend Startup Weekend?:

•Education
•Build your network
•Find a co-founder
•Learn something new
•Get face time with thought leaders
•Actually launch a business

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com

results.description:
Hi Everyone
Here's unique opportunity to learn from a skilled artisanal cheesemaker. It promises to be a great weekend. Hope to see some of you at the events.  Tickets can be purchased for each event or as a package.  Classes are limited to 20 people so act quickly if you are interested. Here's the link to register.

Best,
Angela Davis
NYC Ferments Co-organizer

Event Description
A full weekend of real cheese making with events to suit everyone from the novice to the expert, all under the masterful direction of cheese maker and author David Asher.

Culture in the Caves Reception
FRIDAY SEPT. 11 - 6:30PM TO 9PM
A lecture by David Asher on the cultures (both microbial and human) central to his cheesemaking methods is the highlight of this evening. Enjoy the rare chance to go 30 feet beneath the streets into the historic lagering tunnels of a long-shuttered brewery, now home to Crown Height's own affineur: Crown Finish Caves. Small batch drinks and cheeses included in ticket price as well as delicious local nibbles prepared by "Snail of Approval" caterers Pixie and the Scout. Books available for purchase and signing by the author.

Cheesemaking Workshops
All workshops focus on natural techniques that can easily be reproduced at home or at small scale cheesemaking facilities. Participants will learn how to take the steps to make their cheeses more naturally, without packaged starters, additives and chemicals, and how to source the best possible milk for their cheesemaking. Workshops are demonstration style -we all make cheese together round the table. Each workshop is limited to 20 participants. A signed copy of Mr. Asher's book, The Art of Natural Cheesemaking, is included in the workshop ticket price.


"Rennet Free Cheesemaking"
SATURDAY, SEPT 12 - 10AM TO 1PM
Learn to make great cheese without rennet. This class looks at two styles of cheesemaking: lactic cheeses and heat - acid cheeses. See the secrets to making great Paneer (AKA Queso Fresco), yogurt and yogurt cheese. And all entirely naturally.

"Chèvre and Mouldy Goat Cheeses"
SATURDAY, SEPT 12 - 2PM TO 5PM
Fresh Chèvre is the starting point for this workshop - a simple cheese that is a breeze to make at home. Participants will then learn how to prepare mouldy aged goats cheeses like Crottin, Saint Valencay and Saint Marcellin from the very same Chèvre curd.

"Introduction to Rennet Cheesemaking"
SUNDAY, SEPT 13 - 10AM TO 1PM
An introductory course that looks into the making of basic rennet cheese curd, the foundational recipe from which nearly every type of rennet cheese evolves, including Camembert, which will also be explored in this class. As the curd sets, we'll make a batch of yogurt cheese - a super simple technique, and a great cheese to start with. Kefir, a multifaceted probiotic and cheesemaking starter culture, will also be covered.

"Rennet Cheesemaking Part II"
SUNDAY, SEPT 13 - 2PM TO 5PM
A survey course that demonstrates the making of a broad range of cheeses that evolve from the basic rennet curds made in the Introduction to Natural Cheesemaking class. Participants will learn how to grow white rinds on their Camembert, how to make their cheeses Blue, how to transform them into stinky Limburger too, and lets not forget Feta and Mozzarella. We will also explore the making of Tomme, a firm alpine cheese from the foothills of the Alps. And all of these will be made without packaged starter cultures!

This event series is a collaboration between Crown Finish Caves and Slow Food USA. Proceeds support Slow Food's work to bring good, clean, and fair food to all in communities around the world.
results.name: The Art of Natural Cheesemaking Weekend Workshops with David Asher, 9.11-9.13

results.description:
Join us for the next Startup Weekend, Global Fashion Battle! This event will focus around fashion technology. The winning team will win a all expense paid trip to Poland, where they will compete in a global pitch competition!

TICKETS: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/startup-weekend-nyc-global-fashion-battle-tickets-18142098505

More info about the Global Battle: https://globalfashionbattle.co/

So...what is it? 

Startup Weekend is a 54 hour event that brings together people from all backgrounds to build a startup business in a weekend! For this event, we are focusing on fashion technology.


Why attend Startup Weekend?

Education: Startup Weekends are all about learning through the act of creating. Don’t just listen to theory, build your own strategy and test it as you go.

Build your network: This isn’t just a happy-hour. Startup Weekend attracts your community’s best makers and do-ers. By spending a weekend working to build scalable companies that solve real-world problems, you will build long-lasting relationships and possibly walk away with a job or even an investor.

Find a co-founder: We all know it’s not just about the idea – it’s about the team. Startup Weekend is hands down the best way to find someone you can actually launch a startup with.

Learn something new: Step outside of your comfort zone. With a whole weekend dedicated to letting your creative juices flow, Startup Weekends are perfect opportunities to work on a new platform, learn a new programming language, or just try something different.

Get face time with thought leaders: Local tech and startup leaders participate in Startup Weekends as coaches and judges. Get some one-on-one time with the movers and shakers in your community. Actually launch a business: Over 36% of Startup Weekend startups are still going strong after 3 months. Roughly 80% of participants plan on continuing working with their team or startup after the weekend. 

Who should attend Startup Weekend Global Fashion Battle?

It doesn't matter if you are in the fashion industry or not. Come with an open mind and get ready to build something truly amazing and innovative. If you are in the fashion industry (eg: designer, buyer, seller, marketing, sales, advertising, PR, front of house, back of house, etc) or not (eg: mobile designer, application developer, business development, sales, student, teacher, etc), you are most welcome to participate in the weekend.

Do I need to come with an idea?

If you have an idea for a startup, then great! We hope you pitch for the weekend. If you don't have an idea, thats quite alright! Come and spend the weekend, listen to the ideas being pitched and maybe something strikes your interest. The weekend is all about learning about the startup ideation process and learning from each other.

If you have more questions, checkout the Startup Weekend First Timers FAQ
results.name: Global Startup Fashion Battle

results.description:
Q&A with director Caetano Gotardo.


Three very different mothers are confronted, through three very different trials-by-ordeal, with the limits of what a mother “just knows”.  With little fanfare (and not a whiff of the blatant “interconnectedness” often de rigeur among multi-story films), the daily rhythms and textures of three families unfold before us. And at the end of each story, all three mothers emerge from their private crucibles with an understanding — though one that can only be expressed in a way that erupts into the film’s very reality.

In the film’s first story, a mother (Maria Júlia, played by famed Brazilian actress, singer and performer Cida Moreira), learns about her son’s most intimate secret maybe a minute too late. On the second tale, an enigmatically afflicted sound engineer (Eduardo, played by Rômulo Braga) skulks through his day of nausea and confusion, while his wife Silvia (Andréa Marquee) muses on the scope of infant wisdom with a friend, as the two gaze at the former’s child. What happens next throws both parents into a state of trauma. The last story follows João (Henrique Schafer) and Ana (Fernanda Vianna), on their preparations to re-encounter their long-lost son.

Portuguese with English subtitles / Running time: 97 minutes / Year: 2013
results.name: Movie Night: O Que Se Move (The Moving Creatures)

Join us for the next Startup Weekend, Global Fashion Battle! This event will focus around fashion technology. What is fashion technology? In a broad sense, it’s when fashion (what we wear, what we aspire to be, how we present ourselves to society through clothing) meets technology (innovation, a digital presence, engaging online & mobile content.) It’s fashion embracing a new and digital component to sell / present their business model. It’s where technology and fashion have merged to create faster and more innovative ways to shop, market, educate and ultimately experience the fashion industry whether through software, apps or products. From e-commerce to 3D printing to wearables, fashion technology covers a wide spectrum of applicable use cases.
results.name: Startup Weekend NYC Fashion Tech Edition

GERMAN SPANISH KOREAN

8:30 pm - 10:00 pm SPANISH @ Mexican Cafe & Tequila Bar  
10:00pm-11:30pm+ KOREAN @ Korean Karaoke place  

------
Weissbier“white beer” in German, the name derives from the yellowish-white tinge that is imparted by the pale malted wheat from which the brew is made 

------

Tequila A spirit made from juice of the Blue Agave plant
Gold Tequila Caramel coloring added to the tequila 
Silver / Blanco Tequila Aged a couple of weeks
Reposado Tequila Aged 2 months-1 year
Añejo Tequila Aged 1 year-3 years
Extra or ultra añejo Aged 3+ years
Margarita A Cocktail made with tequila & citrus fruit juice 
------
Soju  A spirit made from rice
------

Rules of the Game!

1) Meet at designated spot, state the password to the organizer 
2) Try 1 drink from that culture @ bar. Must purchase 1 drink of anything at each location
3) Conversation, learning, practice languages 1 hr each bar
4) To go to the next bar EVERYONE must say 1 new word in that language they learned! 1 Phrase for more advanced learners

Write the languages you are learning so that way we can match up for conversation partners! 

NOTE* This is the first time we are trying this so its not going to be perfect (yet).  Expect these bars to be loud & full like any other Friday. Bring ID.

95% positive  we'll all end up practicing a very interesting English by the end of the night :p

results.description:
Learn to act while overcoming stage fright. Meet new people and increase your confidence and poise. 10-session program. Scene Work - Improvisation - Monologue Study - Showcase Performance opportunities.

The focus is on relaxation and natural performance based on sound fundamental acting technique. We also provide the unique opportunity to perform before live audiences in our own in-house showcase productions.

Acting programs are often very intimidating. The instructors are harsh and anxiety is not addressed. We offer a more humane and effective alternative. Our program is designed to empower as well as guide you through the acting experience.

Many people who attend our classes have never acted before and just need a supportive environment to try it out. We work in very manageable steps. You will not be asked to do anything you are not comfortable with.

Please do come in and see for yourself, if the program is right for you.

 

Initial session is free of charge. If you do decide to enroll at the
Free Trial, you will receive a $49.00 discount, and 2 bonus sessions.

Discounted rate:$250 for 12 sessions.

Regular rate: $299 for 10 sessions

results.description:
www.rottentomatoes.com/m/machete_maidens_unleashed</a>

<a href="http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1623757/">www.IMDB.com/title/tt[masked]

In the 1960s and 70s, drive-in movie theaters and big city GRINDHOUSES were eager to book the wildest and most action-packed fare they could find, and low-budget producers were always on the lookout for something unique to offer their viewers. Many of them found it in the Philippines, a country full of exotic locations, cooperative officials and folks willing to work cheap.

Local producer Eddie Romero began exporting his cut-rate horror and crime pictures to American distributors in the 60s, and before long U.S. filmmakers were traveling there to shoot crazed jungle epics, women in prison thrillers, bloody horror stories and violent wartime dramas. It certainly helped that Philippine extras and technicians would work hard for low pay, and that local stuntmen didn't seem to worry much about risking their necks for a good shot; as one producer put it, "Human life was cheap, film was cheap -- it was a great place to shoot a movie!"



Filmmaker Mark Hartley, who shared the crazed true story of the Australian exploitation movie scene in his documentary Not Quite Hollywood, shares the inside scoop on the wild and wooly world of filmmaking in the Philippines in the 1960s and 70s in Machete Maidens Unleashed!

Featuring interviews with Gloria Hendry, Colleen Camp, Sid Haig, R. Lee Ermey, Roger Corman, Joe Dante, Allan Arkush and many more eyewitnesses to the madness of movie making in the Philippine jungles, Machete Maidens Unleashed! was an official selection at the 2010 Toronto International Film Festival.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y8RWyvDZeMA

Followed by the 1982 Filipino classic, RAW FORCE!


www.IMDB.com/title/tt[masked]

Beginners' Workshop begins at 6:30 pm.  Contra Dance is a traditional American folk dance which requires no prior dance training or experience—if you can walk, you can Contra Dance.  Traditional Contra Dancing is done with "Ladies and Gents" but at Gender Role-Free Dances we dance whichever role we like and with whomever we like!  Our monthly dances are open to everyone, regardless of sexual orientation, gender expression, dance experience and number of left feet.

Our caller for this dance will be Susan McElroy-Marcus and the band is Squeezeblow Strumbow, including concertina, harmonica, guitar, and fiddle.  The caller hales from Cincinnati, OH and the band is terrific.


Join us after the dance for socializing at the Village Den around the corner at 11th St. and Greenwich Ave.

For more information, check out our new website: www.villagecontra.org or our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/villagecontra/

results.description:
It's been 3 years since the old gang fought the Five Animals, The Time Beast, and rescued Hermel's sister and Yellow Clay Village from Black Patch's Brigands.   They've spent their time happily farming and raising families, selling umbrellas, starting the Rockafella Sulfur mine outside of town, and enjoying the growing prosperity of Yellow Clay.

But as always, things change.  The growing prosperity has come at a cost.  The peaceful rural life that Hermel so loved has been increasingly disrupted by strangers bringing brawls, theft, and now perhaps even murder.  The town council has been unable to stem the tide of troubles, even as the Treasury's coffers have been filling up with gold.   The Rockafella Sulfur Mine seems to have become both a blessing and a curse to the town.

Furthermore recently rumors have it that strange sounds (howlings?) are being heard at night from across the Wild Moors to the west.  Worse yet, several children have vanished in the dead of night ... whisked away from their beds while their hard working parents slept.  A crowd gathers at the Emergency Meeting of Town Council eager to hear what is to be done!

Elthos RPG is an experimental RPG utilizing light-weight mechanics for fast story-oriented play.  We have a couple of open seats for new Players.  The previous Game Test Stories will give you some idea of the nature of the Elthos World, and what kind of adventures one might expect in it.  You're welcome to join in the fun while seats remain open.  To inquire just send me an email and I'll respond asap!

:) Mark
results.why: Its fun!  Especially if you like light weight systems with an emphasis on story, but plenty of tactical elements to make the whole thing a great game.

Sarah Eve is a culinary shaman, making magic in the kitchen and healing from the heart. She is a certified Usui Reiki master and practicing shaman with a deep love of the healing arts. Sarah Eve began her shamanic studies with Izhak Beery and followed with the late Ipupiara, a Makunaiman of the Ure-e-wau-wau Amazonian tribe. She has completed workshops with Tom Cowan and the 13 Indigenous Grandmothers. The path of healing also led her to work closely with the Santo Daime community, John of God, and crystal energy work in Brazil. Rebecca Gordon (Siri Radha Kaur) is a celebrated astrologer, author, presenter and founder of the My Path Astrology School in New York which is now hosting a suite of online classes. From healing astrology readings to inspiring international retreats, classes and workshops, Rebecca and her vibrant practice have helped thousands over the past 15 years align with their true life path. She has been gifted with the ability to translate cosmic symbols into everyday wisdom that transforms people’s lives and optimizes potentials. Rebecca’s horoscopes and talents have appeared in Conde Nast, Elle Magazine, Epicurious, The Daily News, ABC, Prevention Magazine, and Well & Good, among others. She has also brought astrology to the masses on Baidu, China’s leading search engine, where her Yeah Ahead videos are evergreen fixtures on the homepage. Rebecca is an active member of and contributing author to the International Society for Astrological Research (ISAR) and is excited to release her first publication with Simon and Schuster in the spring of 2016. Our greatest navigation tool here on earth are the great stars and planets above. She looks forward to being your guide.

On the occasion of Arvo Pärt’s 80th birthday, the Met toasts the composer’s health and long life with a concert of his music led by Joel Sachs—world-renowned advocate for the newest of music, who originally introduced Pärt’s indelible voice to the West—directing the New Juilliard Ensemble. These superb young artists offer an evening of the composer’s magnificent chamber music, including works for string quartet, piano, and other solo instruments, as well as voice. 


The program culminates with New York City Ballet Principals Amar Ramasar and Rebecca Krohn performing Christopher Wheeldon’s “wondrous” (New York Times) Liturgy, set to Pärt’s Fratres.

results.description:
I maybe not Italian American, but I am for this day!!!!   I love it when San Gennaro comes around every year.  This is the day as Alex calls it "cheat day".  Yes, there are enough carbs and fried dough here to kill a small country but this festival (“the feast of feasts,” as it’s dubbed) is all heart. It’s where the “Cannoli King” is local royalty, and his court smells curiously like spaghetti and meatballs. You can also buy yourself a $5 funnel cake or cannolis — if you still have room after gorging on all the fried Oreos, Reese’s and Twinkies. Also there are fun carnival games (Michelle and I are addicted to) to win yourself a stuffed animal, Some fun rides and activities and some night market shopping!'

Presented annually since 1996 by Figli di San Gennaro, Inc. (Children of San Gennaro), a not-for-profit community organization dedicated to keeping alive the spirit and faith of the early Italian immigrants, this year’s Feast is expected once again to attract more than one-million people from the four corners of the globe to the streets of Little Italy to participate in the annual Salute to the Patron Saint of Naples.

Although this is an annual celebration of faith, the Feast of San Gennaro is known the world over for its festive atmosphere, an 11-day event featuring religious processions and colorful parades, free musical entertainment every day, a wide variety of ethnic food delicacies, charming restaurants and cafes and even a world-famous cannoli-eating competition!

So come and enjoy the fun.
results.name: San Gennaro Festival!

results.description:
Do you know your reefer rights?


We are a cross-disciplinary coalition of radical artists, social media experts and grassroots organizers from the Occupy Wall Street community who have teamed up with drug policy experts from the Empire State Chapter of the National Organization for the Reform of Marijuana Laws (NORML) to become the "militant wing of the marijuana legalization movement" in NYC. 


Governor Cuomo's Compassionate Care Act is a deadly insult. Progressive leaders in Albany like Senator Liz Krueger tells us that it will be at least another half decade before her Marijuana Regulation and Taxation Act will have a chance of passing the senate floor. We find this unacceptable.

BYOW & Meet Up with us every Friday night for fun and free education on how to safely stay high and get by without getting busted while we organize and creatively fight for legal recreational cannabis in NYC.

Thank you to everyone who came to our last Game Night!  It was heaps of fun and conquest!   :)

We hope you join us on our next Game Night for a chance to meet tons of new people, play some great games, and drink a few beers. And make sure to invite your friends! We'll have Jamaican/Caribbean dominoes as well. This is one of our favorite strategy games and we would love to share it with the experienced and inexperienced alike.

In addition to dominoes, we will have Settlers of Catan, King of Tokyo, BANG!, Cards Against Humanity, and others. If you'd like to bring your own games, there will be lots of people who like to learn new games.  And again, all are welcome!

Also make sure to bring some cash for a donation.  Though donations are not required, if you are able to donate we suggest $5 for gaming and $5-10 if you're drinking and gaming. Organizing this is 100% volunteer and all the money goes to this MU page, refreshments, and renting the space.

Rebecca is an active member of and contributing author to the International Society for Astrological Research (ISAR) and is excited to release her first publication with Simon and Schuster in the spring of 2016. Our greatest navigation tool here on earth are the great stars and planets above. She looks forward to being your guide.

results.description:
Women’s New Moon Healing Sanctuary- Honoring Sept 11th and Solar Eclipse Celebration with special guest Astrologist Rebecca Gordon!

Come join a sacred circle of women where we will explore the New Moon Solar Eclipse in Virgo!

This is a powerful time to clarify the remainder of the year and perhaps beyond, in addition to understanding how the eclipse can push us to walk our most authentic and successful paths.

Special guest Rebecca Gordon shares how this rare cosmic event can be a “true karmic expeditor. The eclipse asks us to step into a life that is more aligned with our souls’ intention. Eclipses are masterful at cleaning house in your life, your work, your relationships, as they have a way of directly addressing what is not in harmony with your truth”.

We will furthermore learn how each astrological sign will be most significantly affected by eclipse and what you can personally do to shine your brightest!

September 11th is also marked as a reverent day in the minds of New Yorkers and beyond. In this ceremonial circle we will acknowledge this energy with prayer and meditation as well.

All goddesses are welcome to join this expansive evening.


The program will include:
• Opening Ceremony
• Healing Shamanic Drum Journeying
• Learning about astrology in relation to the eclipse
• Heart Opening Vegan Chocolate
• Community LOVE & more!

When: Friday September 11th 2015

Time: 7-9:00 pm

*Please be respectful and arrive on time as we will open ceremony promptly.

Where: Jeanette Stoner Studio
83 Leonard Street 5th Floor
Tribeca NYC

Cost: $25 or two for $40 if one brings a friend.

RSVP for one: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=2YC8XWYVCQJXQ

RSVP for two: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=UXF88JWC2AFFW


Sarah Eve is a culinary shaman, making magic in the kitchen and healing from the heart. She is a certified Usui Reiki master and practicing shaman with a deep love of the healing arts. Sarah Eve began her shamanic studies with Izhak Beery and followed with the late Ipupiara, a Makunaiman of the Ure-e-wau-wau Amazonian tribe. She has completed workshops with Tom Cowan and the 13 Indigenous Grandmothers. The path of healing also led her to work closely with the Santo Daime community, John of God, and crystal energy work in Brazil. Other international trips including Mexico and Central America, Europe, Israel, and Southeast Asia, she encountered sacred spiritual practices and healers in which she is blessed to share and teach. She completed her 200 & 500 hour yoga training with Sri Dharma Mittra. Integrating her experience also as a vegan chef, she uses food as another medicinal tool in achieving whole body health. She assists in creating a safe space in which you can heal you. www.sarahevecardell.com

Rebecca Gordon (Siri Radha Kaur) is a celebrated astrologer, author, presenter and founder of the My Path Astrology School in New York which is now hosting a suite of online classes. From healing astrology readings to inspiring international retreats, classes and workshops, Rebecca and her vibrant practice have helped thousands over the past 15 years align with their true life path. She has been gifted with the ability to translate cosmic symbols into everyday wisdom that transforms people’s lives and optimizes potentials. Rebecca’s horoscopes and talents have appeared in Conde Nast, Elle Magazine, Epicurious, The Daily News, ABC, Prevention Magazine, and Well & Good, among others. She has also brought astrology to the masses on Baidu, China’s leading search engine, where her Yeah Ahead videos are evergreen fixtures on the homepage. Rebecca is an active member of and contributing author to the International Society for Astrological Research (ISAR) and is excited to release her first publication with Simon and Schuster in the spring of 2016. Our greatest navigation tool here on earth are the great stars and planets above. She looks forward to being your guide.

results.description:
Raymi Peruvian Kitchen & Pisco 

A modern Peruvian restaurant as dynamic as the country it celebrates. Raymi captures the multicultural spirit of Peru, blending the Spanish, Japanese, Chinese, and native influences that embody the country’s vibrant cuisine. The flavors are once familiar, adventurous, unexpected.

The Raymi experience revolves around a central Ceviche Bar, offering fresh seafood spiked with indigenous spices and ingredients. Add to that a Pisco Bar, pouring select labels and crafting specialty cocktails. A selection of small and large plates showcases the Peruvian palate while encouraging guests to share and linger in the sensual Latin setting.

http://rayminyc.com/menus/raymi_cocktails.pdf

results.name: Peruvian Dinner at Raymi

results.description:
Our minds are very important; how we react to and perceive the world forms the basis of our actions and life experiences. Meditation helps us stabilize our mind and understand the world in a way that is beneficial to ourselves and others. Through Shamatha ("Calm Abiding"), we can gain control of our mind by reducing automatic reactions to thoughts, allowing them to arise and subside on their own. In doing so we can develop the natural calmness needed to investigate and gain clear insight about the true nature of the outer world and our own mind, or the wisdom of enlightenment (Vipashyana).

Khenchen will give instructions on how to practice Shamatha and Vipashyana, and lead a guided meditation. This class is free of charge and all are welcome.

Khenchen Tsewang Gyatso Rinpoche is one of three senior-most professors of Buddhist philosophy at the distinguished Ngagyur Nyingma Institute of Namdroling Monastery in India, where he has taught for over 30 years. In addition, Khenchen has taught extensively in the United States for more than 20 years, and is known for his compassion, humor and easygoing manner, as well as an ability to convey the heart essence of Tibetan Buddhism to western students.

For a more extensive biography, see here:
http://www.palyulnyc.org/?page_id=177
results.name: Guide to Shamatha & Vipashyana Meditation with Khenchen Tsewang Gyatso Rinpoche

results.description:
Clear Emotional Baggage With Dr. Jay Kantor

The ability to process what happens to us psychologically and emotionally is critical to remaining functional. If we cannot process – come to grips with and deal with – the events in our life, these events become traumas which continue to have a negative impact on the functioning of our mind.

How capable are you in processing emotions – acknowledging what you’re feeling, allowing yourself to feel, and expressing and releasing your feelings?

Do feelings scare you?  Do you try to avoid and hide them? Are you embarrassed by what you feel, or that you have feelings at all?  Is it easy or very hard to get over powerful emotional reactions?

Where do our emotional habits come from?  Why do we respond to emotions the way we do?

That’s the topic of tonight’s program.

We will explore the origin of how we respond to and deal with emotions, and we will see what we can do to alter emotional habits that currently lock us up in a painful prison of emotions.  Come prepared to consider liberating yourself from a potential life sentence of suffering.

Program starts at 7:30 with Dr. Jay Kantor – http://DrJayKantor.Com .
results.name: Clear Emotional Baggage With Dr. Jay Kantor

Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!

results.description:
Join us for a screening of Wadjda, a groundbreaking Saudi film that gives insight into Saudi Arabia’s cultural gender norms while emphasizing the universal longing for freedom. This film is respectful of culture and presents a poignant story that asks viewers to question their beliefs and come to answers in their own time. 

Wadjda is the first feature film made by a female Saudi director and the first movie shot entirely within the Kingdom’s borders. It is a wonderful movie that has won numerous awards at international film festivals and was the first film submitted to the Academy Awards by Saudi Arabia:

Wadjda is a spirited and rebellious 10-year old girl who desperately wants a bicycle, something unheard of for girls in her country. Shrugging off prohibitions, Wadjda does the unimaginable to make her wish come true. She sells homemade bracelets at school, forcefully demands an older male shopkeeper to refrain from selling “her” bike to anyone else, and even enters a Quran recitation contest. Since Wadjda is not religiously inclined and often gets in trouble, she surprises her teachers when entering this competition. They believe she had a change of heart and will now behave as a ‘good’ Muslim girl…but they are in for a surprise!

We will have some light foods and a discussion after the film. You are welcome to bring healthy snacks to share.

Notice: The attendees will be requested to contribute $ 5 each to help with the cost of renting the meeting room.
results.name: Screening of Wadjda

results.description:
Marking Disasters: Tisha b’Av (the 9th of Av) and 9/11 (the 11th of September)

National traumas – like the destruction of the Temple in Jerusalem and the terrorist attack on the World Trade Center buildings – are seared into our minds. They are known by their dates alone. Any additional titles are superfluous. But what happens over time to the way we absorb and mark these days, especially when we are separated from them by centuries? How do they enter into our collective experience and memory? What can we learn from how we observe and mark Tisha b’Av that may inform us about the long-lasting effect of 9/11? Rabbi Peter Schweitzer will explore these questions and invite discussion.

Following our service and program, join us for pot-luck dessert and schmoozing.
results.name: Shabbat Service & Cultural Program - Marking Disasters

results.description:
Open level class. Any level student can practice, taking the postures to a more challenging experience. Beginners are welcome, postures can always be modified to suit the individual. As always, listen to your body, take the postures to were it feels right for you and have fun! This class builds upon Basic  yoga postures, continuing our growth. Students always have the option to take this class where they desire... from a basic level and build foundation or to more challenging postures and flow techniques. It all depends on the individual and what their body needs ! Its an open field  for exploration and discovery.

 Breathing techniques focused upon during practice to connect the body and mind with the breath. Power Yoga builds muscle strength from the core outward, tones the body, creates endurance and stamina. Great for over all health. Breathing techniques calm the mind and ground the self.

There is a 15 minute optional deep relaxation and  guided meditation after class going deeper into chakra balancing.

We play 1-2 games of Scrabble (of varied competition levels) before those who wish to participate engage in a friendly group game while others continue playing Scrabble..

SO, COME JOIN US FOR A NIGHT WHERE,
ABOVE ALL, WE HAVE ONE HOUSE RULE—

LET FUN BE #1!!!

Friday Night Meetups begin at 8pm and end at 10:30

This evening is for Beginners-to-Intermediate. Perfect for folks new to the group. RSVPS open at 12:30 noon on Tuesdays! 

Come out, get a great workout and make new friends!!

GAME RULES:

-On serves only one REDO will be granted per player per game on first serve. (Can hit any obstacle (except lighting) and ball cannot be going out of bounds on sides) After a successful serve(s), no redos! (Beneficial to players waiting to sub in)

- NO REDOS on ceiling obstacles only on WIRE (less arguing, will speed up games)

-If each team fouls they both will cancel each other and a redo will be played immediately 

-No Net touches top or bottom (For Safety of all players)

Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every week we go to someone's apt, park, or bar.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Harry

www.tennis-buffs.com

 

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time.  I would like to stagger players.  You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left.  Thank you for your understanding.

 


Fridays, start 8pm
Cost $40, includes tennis, balls and food
6 Indoor hard courts

 

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends.

 

It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.  You can choose to play as many hours as you wish.  Just tell me when you RSVP, when you arrive, or before the next scheduled match.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung

ABOUT BWSF2015:Brooklyn Wildlife Summer Festival is an annual diverse and synergistic, indoor and outdoor festival featuring some of the best Independent talent from New York and beyond. The goal of the event is to galvanize the Indie arts and music community and represent its flourishing cultural growth within Brooklyn, with a special focus on Bushwick. BWSF2015 caters to a new youth culture that is multi-faceted, variegated, ethnically ambiguous and racially interwoven. Black, white, red, brown, gay, straight, trans - whatever color or gender… everyone parties together.

The festival is created by artists and is 100% Independent. There is no corporate sponsorship or outside funding. BWSF is unique in that it is the only festival to offer such a large and varied selection of independent artists and musicians, active within the community, gathered in one space. 

BWSF focuses on performers in the Brooklyn arts and entertainment scene and due to the large presence of international artists in Brooklyn, the festival includes performers and participants from all around the world. There will be representation from UK, Germany, Denmark, Australia, Caribbean, Jamaica, Russia and more.

results.description:
A central part of meditation is quietening our mind that is barraged with endless thoughts. 

An effective way to achieve this is to focus on one particular thing - the breath (in Pranayam), or a chanted sound (in transcendental meditation). 

In this meetup, after a brief introduction, we will explore these two meditative techniques. 

Some questions we will explore: 

- why is transcendental meditation so popular with so many celebrities? 

- how does kapalbhati make me feel so invigorated? 

- what are the origins of Om/Aum and might there be some connections with science?

- how can anulom-vilom make me feel more balanced?

There is no fee for this class. 


The class will be an hour long. In case of popular demand, we might explore a few other concepts and go for longer.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at 20th Street and Avenue C. We will then cross the street to get right next to the river.
results.name: Free Guided Meditation: Pranayam and Transcendental Meditation

'll repeat the Google Wallet instructions for those unaccustomed: ***In the notes section of the payment, please leave your name and what event you are paying for! Thanks
-Download the Google Wallet app on your phone. You'll have to have a gmail account to register your username with this service if you don't already have gmail (in that case create a gmail account first... I did the same thing awhile back just to use this service)

- Create a 4 digit PIN to sign into Google Wallet. Then you'll be on the app homepage. -The left button says 'send money'. Click it and you'll have a screen where you can input a name or email address. My email address for this is [masked] .

-Once you input my username you'll see the screen where you type in the dollar amount. Once done, click the gray 'next', then the blue 'review' button in the upper right corner. -This takes to a confirmation screen. If anything looks off just click the left button on the upper lefthand side to go back a page. Otherwise, you confirm it and click send. Done! An icon will appear in your notifications area letting you know it's sent to me.

From now on, every event will not require a payment to rsvp on this page, I will check the rsvps daily to make sure everyone followed up - any issues message me on here and we will figure it out. Please work with me and send the payment when you register for the event... after this first set up it will take ten seconds each week. If you register and don't pay within 24 hours i'll reach out to you and then have to open the spot back up.. work with me here please, that would not be fun

Back by popular demand the "Let Me Speak To Your Manager" show is bringing you the best up and coming comics in NYC, all of whom have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc..!

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room. Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum. Come out and get over the hump with some laughs!
results.name: Let Me Speak To Your Manager- Free Comedy Show

results.description:
Get Your Tickets Here: https://quietevents.com/events/5-beer-garden-party-in-astoria-10/

Quiet Clubbing invades the famous Bohemian Hall Beer Garden in Astoria. Hundreds of people, tons of drinks, 3 DJs, and one crazy party outdoors!

This prime clubbing spot we exploit because of NYC’s noise ordinance on loud music after 10pm, but NOT TONIGHT! The party kicks off at 10pm when the headphones go on and DJs take the stage. They’ll be spinning everything to keep you singing, drinking and dancing till 2am!

DJ 1 (Blue) – Hip Hop / R&B
DJ 2 (Red) – 80’s, 90’s, 2K and Old School hits
DJ 3 (Green) – Top 40, EDM, and Crowd favorites

Age: 21+

HOW IT WORKS

***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJs with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.
results.name: $5 Beer Garden Party in Astoria

results.description:
This once-controversial entry in the slasher film cycle of the early 1980's looks like a period piece by modern standards but still has a charm all its own for fans of trashy horror flicks. Screenwriter Rita Mae Brown, better known for her feminist fiction, intended for her script to be played as a satire but director Amy Jones instead plays it straight. As a formula slasher film, it's not bad. Characterizations tend towards the formulaic but Brown shows a better understanding of female relationships and banter than her male counterparts usually do. The young female leads are pleasant but mostly interchangeable: the standout performances come from Jennifer Meyers as an amusingly bratty kid sister and Michael Villella as the sweaty, bug-eyed killer. Jones imitates a lot of the stylistic tics John Carpenter displayed in Halloween (prowling camerawork, an ominous synthesizer score, using suburban settings to ironically creepy effect) and builds a decent amount of suspense. She doesn't shy away from sleaze (a gratuitous shower scene is taken to self-parodic extremes) and creates an effectively tense and bloody finale. In short, The Slumber Party Massacre isn't likely to interest anyone outside the horror movie fanbase but those fans will find it to be a solid little programmer.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QVkY09sUTq0
results.how_to_find_us: we will meet in the upstairs bar/lobby
results.name: Slumber Party Massacre 35mm film print Midnight movie

results.description:
Join me for a great workout while beating the crowds with the potential for an awesome sunrise :)!

Please follow the two golden rules :)

1) Hike Safe !

2) Have Fun!

 Directions :NY Route 9D, look for Bob's Corner Store in Beacon. Turn east onto Howland Avenue. then immediately turn right into the parking area for Scenic Hudson's Mount Beacon Park.

Public Transportation: Metro-North Hudson Line to Beacon station -- walk uphill to trailhead

Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding lookout point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson River and surrounding area.

Distance: 4 miles round trip
The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain. Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit. On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).


You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.


If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

PEACE OUT !
results.name: Mt. Beacon ~ Fire Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE ~ Saturday Edition

results.description:
**This event is for dogs and their pet parents!

Rain, sleet, snow (sorry - snow can get the best of us sometime) or shine, FIDO in Prospect Park sets up a table full of goodies on the first Saturday of every month.  Look for coffee, pastries, dog biscuits as well as relevant information pertaining to off-leash activities and issues. And it's all FREE!

Afterwards I usually walk over to the Farmers Market at Grand Army Plaza and pickup some groceries before heading home.

results.description:
Closest Zipline Tour to NYC

Open Year Round, this fun-filled tour will satisfy anyone’s sense of adventure! Boasting unrivalled panoramic views of the tri-state area, you will zoom at smile-inducing speeds as you travel along a series of ziplines (ranging from 200ft to 1,500ft in length) suspended high above a mountain-top lake.

Hidden away, 1040 feet on top of Mountain Creek, gain a new perspective of the area as you trek, zoom and ride around our course area on this guided tour.

Open weekends and holidays throughout the off-peak season. Tour length may vary due to Gondola seasonal operations - please contact us for more information.

More About Zoom Ziplines

After ziplining, we will have lunch at a local restaurant.

Depart Date: September 12th Saturday; arrive 15 minutes earlier.


Depart 7:45 AM: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map) 

Depart 8:30 AM: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of West 43rd St. & 9th Ave, New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Return: Expect to be back in NYC at 3:30 PM and Flushing at 4:00 PM

Cost: Early birds $79 (retail price $99 with transport) first 8 spots or 14 days in advance; Afterward Regular $89.

Trip includes: Round trip Benz Sprinter van transportation from NYC, 2 hours Zoom Ziplines, tolls fee and parking fee.

Buy Ticket Here: http://sep2015zoomziplines.eventbrite.com/ or you can Chase Quickpay me the amount indicated above to [masked] to avoid transaction fee (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) IF Quickpaying, please indicate your boarding location. Your spot is NOT confirmed until your payment is received.

Maximum: 15

Videos

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Join us at 8am for a run to Hoboken Pier A and back.
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/121375029

Yes, there is a waterfront route to Hoboken. Enjoy the fun of cruising around Hoboken Pier A; around the new park and children playground at Newport where you will feel if you are at the beach. Get inspired by the man made majestic views of Manhattan!

When people hear about meditation, they almost always say that they have either never tried it or they were not able to do it. You may have expected that thoughts were supposed to go away, but when you closed your eyes, more thoughts than ever came up.

We invite you to come and experience how meditation can happen effortlessly with a little attention to our very own breath! The free session will include light yoga, breathing techniques and relaxing meditation and will be led by one of the volunteers of the Art of Living foundation.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

An amazing opportunity for us! Please join and bring friends, family. Non-union and union members invited to march! Please rsvp if possible through this link: http://tinyurl.com/olehd2m

Note that while an rsvp is nice to help us know how many t-shirts are needed, it is not mandatary.  Last minute additions are welcome!  Just show up at 9AM on Saturday.  7th Ave and 44th Street.

Promote Bernie and his pro-union policies while marching with thousands of various trade unionists.

We will assemble at 9AM SHARP on 44th Street & 7 Ave in Manhattan, at the assembly point of the Amalgamated Lithographers (a Bernie-endorsing local of the Teamsters), who have invited all Labor for Bernie supporters and People for Bernie members to march with them as their guests.

After leafleting Sector 1 (SEIU, Teamsters, and more) we will march en masse with the Lithographers at about 10:15 AM at the beginning of the parade. You do not need to be a union member to march. You will be given a t-shirt for the parade, but please wear any other Bernie stuff you have (hats, buttons, stickers).

See you Saturday!

results.description:
Qigong is an ancient practice that utilizes slow flowing movement and deep rhythmic breathing to strengthen joints, muscles, tendons, and bones. It also stimulates circulation of energy in our body and cultivates deep relaxation and enhanced mental clarity.


Participants will be introduced to the foundations of Qigong, including self-massage, stretching, standing postures, and meditation. The forms presented in this program draw from two ancient and widely respected lineages, the Pre-celestial Limitless Gate School (Xiantianwujimen) and the Yiquan School. This weekend program is the introduction and basis for a progressive program of Qigong instruction presented by Eva Wong and authorized instructors.

This program requires pre-registration.  To learn more and register, please visit: http://ny.shambhala.org/program-details/?id=232680


Date details: 

• Saturday, September 12: 9 am - 5 pm (Level I) 

• Sunday, September 13: 9 am- 4:30 pm (Level II)

results.description:
Scuba divers from around the New York tri-state area converge for their sixth year in a row, to participate in an underwater cleanup along our beloved Long Island Sound Shore. This year´s destination is the beach located on Glen Island Park, in New Rochelle.

In addition to the underwater cleanup, volunteers will be performing cleanups along the shores on Glen Island.

"North East Divers Unite", originally organized by The Scuba Sports Club of Westchester County and Captain Mike´s Diving Services on City Island, has successfully brought together scuba diving clubs, conservation and community organizations, as well as local and national businesses to support the cleanup of landmark beaches in our area. After focusing on Orchard Beach for several years, and a subsequent cleanup at Playland and Rye Beaches in May of 2014.


This year we are moving the beach cleanup to Glen Island Park in New Rochelle on September 12th. Which will coincide with International Beach Cleanup Day. North East Divers Unite will be open to the public and (certified) scuba divers.

Free parking in Glen Island Park´s main lot for registered volunteers.

BBQ starts at 2:00 for qualifying volunteers.

Help Remove Excess Debris From Long Island Sound Shores

Contribute to a cleaner New York, by joining The Scuba Sports Club TSSC in their continuing efforts to rid the Long Island Sound of debris, and man–made waste. Afterwards celebrate your efforts at the get–together to follow the cleanup! Collect three pounds of trash at the beach cleanup, and gain entry to the barbecue.

Volunteers Needed!

You can help us make this event a great success!

Like last year, we will have divers in the water as well as clean–up crews along the shore, on the beach and in the grassy areas. You do not need to be a scuba diver to participate! Bring your families and friends, we need as many volunteers as possible, as the area is extensive. We are hoping to collect more trash than ever before, and to accomplish this, we need your support!

Please share the event information with anyone you think may want to attend!

Location: Glen Island in New Rochelle. Located close to I95.

When: September 12, 2015

Subscribe to the NEDU email list for more information at the link below.

http://www.thescubasportsclub.org/events/northeast-divers-unite.html
