results.description:
Beach Yoga day, what does that mean?

We will have a beautiful yoga day at the beach.  No need to spend hours commuting to the beaches in Long Island or New Jersey for a nice day at the shore, sleep in a bit and let's spend the day with swimming, yoga, picnic and playing in the sand of one of NYC's little known secrets -- Rockaway Beach Park 

We will kick back and relax here under the Summer sun, go for a swim, do yoga and just hang and converse or play a game or two. 

Where do we meet and where is this beach ?

Rockaway Park Beach, walking distance away from the last stop on A train. We will meet at the Flight 587 Memorial Park  and find a spot on the beach.

How can i get there ?

You can google "Rockaway Park Beach – 116 st" and drive there or you can take Brooklyn bound A (Rockaway Park Beach) train and get off at the Beach 116 st stop which is the last stop. There are two A trains. One is Far Rockaway another is Rockaway Park Beach. Although they go to the same direction, they split after Broad Channel stop. You can take S shuttle train to the 116th or Rockaway Park Beach after Broad channel . Once you got off at the last stop and leave the station, turn left and walk straight. You will see the park at the end.

This sounds so cool. What the day will be like ?

I know. There is no strict schedule but we will try to follow this:

-12.00 PM - We will meet in the park at 12.00 PM and go to the beach.

-12.30 PM – 30 mins of stretch and basic asanas 

-Free time – Sunbath, swimming, reading etc.

-2.30 PM – 30 mins theoretical class, Questions and answers.

-3,00 PM Picnic/Lunch - You can always bring a sandwich, snack, fruits, nuts etc.

-Free time – beach games included :)

-5.45 PM Sunset Chakra Class


How does the picnic work? 

Just bring whatever you like (vegetarian options please) and share with others. i.e. 

http://www.meetup.com/The-Original-Yoga-System-Classes-are-finally-in-NYC/photos/26163153/?success=uploaded#[masked] 

How are we not going to end up having so many of the same foods/snacks or let's say few people brought cake and juice, how are we going to make sure we will have disposable plates, forks, cups etc. for everyone ?

well, Just let us know through comment section what you are bringing (including plates, forks etc) so we will know what we are going to have and what we will need.

I didn't get it. can you give me an example ?

Ok, let's say you are bringing apricots and strawberries. You will just comment here as " I'm bringing apricots and strawberries" That's it.

Is there a grocery store or restaurant around?

Yes, there are many restaurants and grocery stores. There is actually one fruit market which is recently opened. They always have fresh fruits and nuts there.I love that place. They are all in walking distance to the beach.  

Is there a shower or bathroom ?

Yes, there is a shower and bathroom within walking distance.

I'm a beginner can i still join ? 

Definitely yes. We always have beginners in classes and in fact %40 of the people in classes are beginners. They are all encouraged to join the group and discover many benefits of yoga. Check out  group reviews

http://www.meetup.com/The-Original-Yoga-System-Classes-are-finally-in-NYC/about/comments/?op=all 

I did yoga for a few times and it's been a while.Can i still catch up with the postures do you think?

Instructions during the classes are very clear and easy to follow. Even a small child can follow the class. No flexibility or strength needed.

What are the things we can do during those free times?

Anything you usually do at a beach. Sunbath, swimming, chatting, reading, being a kid again :) Group members are super positive and friendly people and you would feel very comfortable around them.

Can we also play games ?

Absolutely. We are open to all beach-games. Feel free to bring a frisbee or volleyball. Again, we are going to have a beautiful beach day. If you need to come late or leave early, that's OK, too.

Will there be a yoga mat for me ?

No, you should bring your own yoga mat or a towel or a blanket. Whatever is available.

Can I text or call the Organizer ?

Yes, if you have a question which is not answered in here, you can text or call him.

[masked] 

Oh, OK. Let me RSVP then but i'm not sure if i'm going to make it there.

Well, RSVP only if you are really going to make it to the class. 

***Besides emergency situations, members who RSVP and don't show up will be removed from the group. 

I'm not sure if i can make it on time. Can I come later ?

Short answer is NO.We encourage everyone to attend the classes which are free. All you need to do is come on time. 

What kind of yoga class this will be ?

It's based on Patanjali's 8-limbs-system which is gentle yet very effective-take a look at  group reviews-. We will start with breathing & Bioenergy techniques, and continue with standing poses and other pose groups. Before meditation and deep relaxation, we will also have 5 min free time that you can practice any asana you would like. The Instructor will be helping with the postures. 

I am a beginner and i have never tried yoga before. Can i join you guys ?

Beginners are welcome !!! 

Cool, What should I bring with me ?

Your towel, yoga mat, picnic goodies :) maybe a book and your positivity :)

I'll be there for sure!

Great, we will see you there

Peace and Love!

results.description:
Hi everyone,

One of the pillars of Beer Club is philanthropy and last Christmaswe had a successful fundraising event for the Ali Forney Center (AFC).   Now that it is back to school time, the Philanthropy Committee is bringing you another opportunity to make a difference in the lives of those in need.  Tom L. has been working with

For those of you who were not able to attend last time, AFC is the nation's largest and most comprehensive organization dedicated to homeless LGBTQ youth. The center houses adolescent GBLT youths from the ages of 16 – 23 in different facilities throughout NYC. There is currently a waiting list for all the other adolescents who are homeless and living on the streets of NYC. These adolescents go to the walk-in center that the organization has on a daily basis for food, clothing etc. 

We will have a representative of the Center at the meetup to share more information about the work they do. In the meantime, you can find out more about the Ali Forney Center at this website.  http://www.aliforneycenter.org/

Like last time, we want to use this opportunity to help support AFC.  We can do that by bringing items that AFC needs (list below) and participating in our raffle!  We will have some great prizes donated by some group members as well as New York Beer Company.

Here’s the back-to-school wishlist:

*Backpacks/ Bookbags 

*Underwear/t-shirts

Hats, gloves, scarves Socks 

*School supplies (notebooks, pens, markers, etc) 


*Gift cards in denominations of $10 or $20 for the following stores: -

    • McDonalds (everywhere in NYC, dollar menu, many are 24 hours) 

    • Starbucks (great for our college students and for those starting their first job) 

    • Old Navy 

    • ITunes 

They also have a WishList on Amazon if you'd like to send items directly to their center: https://www.amazon.com/gp/registry/wishlist/QMLEI6NWOW47/ref=cm_wl_rlist_go_v?


If you'd like to volunteer to help deliver items collected after the meetup or to help sell raffle tickets, please contact Tom, the event host.

Everyone had a great time at the last event we did for AFC so we’re sure this time will be even better.

Hope to see you there!

Cheers,

Bill

results.description:
Workshop Topic Details:

Web App Pentesting OWASP Top 10

We'll walk through exploiting the most common vulnerabilities listed on the OWASP Top 10 (ex: sql injection, cross site scripting, cross site request forgery, etc) using industry standard testing tools on a vulnerable web app (Vicnum) written by Nicole Becher.

Instructor Bio:

We're excited to have Nicole Becher as our guest instructor. Nicole is a Senior Auditor at CipherTechs, Inc., a security solutions company based in New York City. She specializes in application security, penetration testing and computer forensics. She previously worked for a financial regulator on a variety of projects including assessing the cyber readiness of large and complex financial institutions, drafting formal cyber regulations and was on the team that drafted the first regulatory framework for Bitcoin/virtual currency companies. Nicole is also an adjunct instructor at New York University, teaching courses on offensive and defensive computer security, intrusion detections, web application security and computer forensics. Her research interests include malware analysis, cryptography, hardware programming, web application security, cyber crime and cyber laws/regulation. Nicole is also a fellow of the Madison Policy Forum, a cyber security focused policy group bridging military, government and industry. She is a contributor to the OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project) community and wrote vulnerable software for the “capture the flag” contest at AppSecUSA 2013. 

Bonus: get your resume ready.  CipherTechs is hiring all levels (including entry level).

For Every Workshop:

This is a hands-on workshop where you will put into practice those things you may have read about or covered in a class. This is also a great opportunity to meet other like-minded women and to keep your skills fresh if you're a veteran! You will also earn continuing education credits towards your certification renewal. 

Every workshop progresses from beginner through advanced topic material. Beginners are encouraged to watch and learn as much as possible even though you might not have a clue. Exposure to new tools and techniques by watching will advance your learning process a lot more quickly than trying to learn on your own. You will get to ask questions and see how it's done in the real world. Advanced attendees are encouraged to share their knowledge and experience and help answer "noob" questions as much as possible.

Agenda:

1200 - 100: Set-up, introductions, and lunch (included)

100 - 600:  Training 

(Please note that this will be active workshop time - if you have not completed set-up it will be challenging to follow along.)

600 - ? Dinner/Drinks @ Fraunces Tavern. We'll head out after the workshop to mingle.

Prerequisites:

Basic IT knowledge.

A good attitude and willingness to learn.

Remote and Male Associate Member Participation:

Register online. Once registered, you'll receive the meeting participation info by email the day before the workshop. Expect to join 15-30 minutes prior to test your technical configurations.

Prep Requirements:

Laptop with Kali installed in a virtual machine. Please request assistance with prep - we're happy to help. We don't have time at the workshop to troubleshoot. No need to reinstall if you already have it.

[Easy install. Import the ova file into virtualbox or vmware player. Kali 64 bit or Kali 32 bit>

Download Vicnum

Cost:

Full/Student/Military Member:  $35

Associate Member and Remote Attendee: $15

CTA Member:  FREE with code

Free (non-paying) Member: $50

REGISTER ON WEBSITE:

 http://womenscyberjutsu.org/events/event_details.asp?id=603396

Travel Logistics:

Thinking we (DC folks) can carpool on Sept 11 and head back after dinner on Sept 12.More info on that when you register.
results.name: [Workshop in NY] Web App Pentesting OWASP Top 10

results.description:
Photographer & Model Photoshoot Society Presents:

"Back to School Shoot w/Lexi & Alyssa - Sept. 12th"

We have a last minute Saturday pinup shoot with two member favorites, the beautiful Lexi Styles and gorgeous Alyssa Caruso. 

About the Shoot:

It's back to school month and what better way to start the school year than with a pinup shoot. The ladies will sport some back to school related outfits and we'll have some colored backdrops and decorations for a schoolastic feel. We'll do some high key as well as some other creative lighting.

For new members: Please take the time to read the info below about how the Meetup is organized and how the shooting parameters are setup.

Cost: $80

(Cash preferred, Credit Cards/Paypal ok with $5 added for surcharge)

(Non-Commercial Release provided onsite or PDF version to email registered upon check-in.)

Models:

Alyssa Caruso: Instagram


(Photo Credit: Photodepotbyjoe)


(Photo Credit: NandoPro)


Lexi Styles: MM#[masked]

(Photo Credit: NandoPro)

(Photo Credit: Photodepotbyjoe)

One-on-Ones: The models will be available for half hour one on one shoots after the Meetup. If you want to pre-book time before the shoot, send me a message.

NEW Shared One-on-Ones: We are also implementing a system that has been working for the past few Meetups. It's the sharing of a half hour one on one with a fellow photographer. It can be shared together for the whole half hour or 15 minutes each photographer. 

_______________________________________________________________________

About the Studio:

The studios is a beautiful 3,000 sq. ft., climate controlled,  fully functional studio. (Professional in-house lights, props, various seamless backdrops, actual commercial photography sets, kitchen, waiting room, meeting/presentation room, the works!) It's conveniently located to major highways and a 20-30 minute public transportation ride to and from NY.

About The Meetup Format:

We will keep the group small although we have the space to accommodate a big group. This keeps things from feeling rushed and overwhelming. Each photographer will have a set amount of time per look. This will allow you to  shoot as you would in an actual client shoot and not have to worry about the number of shots you are taking. (This proved to be ideal in our previous shoots as far as being able to get "the shot" and enough time to do so. Think of it as a mini one-on-one time with the model.) During the shoot we may opt to give a theme a direction to shoot for. As it would be for an actual client. (Ex: If the setup calls for a "cover shot" then it will give you a direction to aim for and to consider what equipment to use or what mood to capture.) No worries, bring what lens or lenses you have, you'll learn to use what you have for best results. We strive to bring forth real world conditions and parameters so there is a methodology to a setup or theme.

Check-in Procedure and Disclaimers:

Check-in - When you arrive, there will be a quick check-in. This will mostly be so you can read and adhere to the studio/group shoot guidelines and make payment for the shoot before we start. This will also let us send you the release forms in PDF format if we don't have physical copies available.

Releases - We will have one non-commercial release signed by the model through the studio only. (No additional releases will be signed.) If you need a commercial release signed, you can make arrangements with the model directly. Additional compensation for this is between the model and photographer.

Right to Refuse - We have the right to refuse a member's RSVP to the Meetup. It's a small community and models keep detailed info on photographers also. If we feel there is justifiable reason to refuse a RSVP, we will exercise that right.

Signups - Please signup when you know you will attend. If the signup passes the point to book another model and then we get no shows it's not fair to your fellow photographers who would be on a waiting list. It also puts the organizers in a tough spot, financially after booking an additional model to compensate for a bigger group. So, at the very least give us 3 days notice that you will not be able to attend or in case of no show, we will have to remove you from the group. When emergencies come up past the 3 days notice, followup with an email and we can make exceptions on a case by case basis. 

Model Cancellation - If a model cancels or a last minute model change occurs, you will have the option to cancel beforehand or not attend the Meetup on the day of, if it happens upon arrival to the Meetup.

Waitlist - When you are on a wait list, please be mindful as this is also considered a RSVP of availability. So, if we add another model or someone cancels within the 3 days before the shoot, your wait list status may upgrade to a "Yes". Please be on the lookout for updates on the Meetup page as Meetup sometimes takes longer to notify of a status change.

Updates - Updates will be made on this page up to the date of the Meetup or the night before. Emails will also be sent but Meetup emails are not always reliable to be sent to a receiver right away. (I've heard of emails arriving 3 hours later if at all.)

Postponements - Weather considerations will be made the night before a shoot or on the day of and the Meetup page will be updated as well as emails sent if a postponement occurs due to inclement weather or some other emergency. Lack of minimum RSVP to hold the event will also cause postponement of the shoot. The night before we would make the call wether to postpone so be on the look out for our email and Meetup page updates.

Any questions please email me at [masked]

results.description:
I am a therapist, divorce mediator, and adjunct professor at NYU with a specialization in eating disorders. I am interested in helping to facilitate a monthly meet-up group to discuss experiences, treatment options, and helpful ideas in dealing with eating disorders of all types. I have years of experience treating bulimia, binge eating, anorexia, and issues of body image, with excellent results.


In addition to seeing patients individually for eating disorders (among other issues), I'm currently forming an ongoing, weekly therapy group for persons with eating disorders who are looking for something more ongoing and intensive. I work on a sliding fee scale, so I will do what I can to make it work for you. My approach is a combination of psychodynamic, cognitive-behavioral, and Buddhist principles, with a healthy dose of compassion and understanding!

Our meetups are held in Union Square, near 12th Street and University Place.

Please give me a call or email me if you think you might be interested in attending the meet-ups or in learning more about individual or group therapy. Space is somewhat limited, so if you are interested, it's best to call or email me right away.


Thank you!


Judie Stein, Ph.D., L.M.S.W.
Director
Stein Mediation & Family Center


(212)[masked]
[masked]

www.steinmediation.com

results.description:
Workshop Topic Details:

Web App Pentesting OWASP Top 10

We'll walk through exploiting the most common vulnerabilities listed on the OWASP Top 10 (ex: sql injection, cross site scripting, cross site request forgery, etc) using industry standard testing tools on a vulnerable web app (Vicnum) written by Nicole Becher.

Instructor Bio:

We're excited to have Nicole Becher as our guest instructor. Nicole is a Senior Auditor at CipherTechs, Inc., a security solutions company based in New York City. She specializes in application security, penetration testing and computer forensics. She previously worked for a financial regulator on a variety of projects including assessing the cyber readiness of large and complex financial institutions, drafting formal cyber regulations and was on the team that drafted the first regulatory framework for Bitcoin/virtual currency companies. Nicole is also an adjunct instructor at New York University, teaching courses on offensive and defensive computer security, intrusion detections, web application security and computer forensics. Her research interests include malware analysis, cryptography, hardware programming, web application security, cyber crime and cyber laws/regulation. Nicole is also a fellow of the Madison Policy Forum, a cyber security focused policy group bridging military, government and industry. She is a contributor to the OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project) community and wrote vulnerable software for the “capture the flag” contest at AppSecUSA 2013. 

Bonus: get your resume ready.  CipherTechs is hiring all levels (including entry level).

For Every Workshop:

This is a hands-on workshop where you will put into practice those things you may have read about or covered in a class. This is also a great opportunity to meet other like-minded women and to keep your skills fresh if you're a veteran! You will also earn continuing education credits towards your certification renewal. 

Every workshop progresses from beginner through advanced topic material. Beginners are encouraged to watch and learn as much as possible even though you might not have a clue. Exposure to new tools and techniques by watching will advance your learning process a lot more quickly than trying to learn on your own. You will get to ask questions and see how it's done in the real world. Advanced attendees are encouraged to share their knowledge and experience and help answer "noob" questions as much as possible.

Agenda:

1200 - 100: Set-up, introductions, and lunch (included)

100 - 600:  Training 

(Please note that this will be active workshop time - if you have not completed set-up it will be challenging to follow along.)

600 - ? Dinner/Drinks @ TBD. We'll head out after the workshop to mingle.

Prerequisites:

Basic IT knowledge.

A good attitude and willingness to learn.

Remote and Male Associate Member Participation:

Register online. Once registered, you'll receive the meeting participation info by email the day before the workshop. Expect to join 15-30 minutes prior to test your technical configurations.

Prep Requirements:

Laptop with Kali installed in a virtual machine. Please request assistance with prep - we're happy to help. We don't have time at the workshop to troubleshoot. No need to reinstall if you already have it.

[Easy install. Import the ova file into virtualbox or vmware player. Kali 64 bit or Kali 32 bit>

Download Vicnum

Cost:

Full/Student/Military Member:  $35

Associate Member and Remote Attendee: $15

CTA Member:  FREE with code

Free (non-paying) Member: $50

REGISTER ON WEBSITE:  http://womenscyberjutsu.org/events/event_details.asp?id=603396

Travel Logistics:

Thinking we (DC folks) can carpool on Sept 11 and head back after dinner on Sept 12.More info on that when you register.

This group meets on the second Saturday of each month and spotlights guest speakers from SF and genre related fields of interest.

Notorious (1946) and Strangers On A Train (1951)


Join us for an afternoon of mystery, intrigue and fun by the Master of Suspense - Alfred Hitchcock.  We will screen Notorious (1946) and Strangers on a Train (1951).

Notorious (1946):  In order to help bring Nazis to justice, U.S. government agent T.R. Devlin (Cary Grant) recruits Alicia Huberman, the American daughter of a convicted German war criminal, as a spy. As they begin to fall for one another, Alicia is instructed to win the affections of Alexander Sebastian (Claude Rains), a Nazi hiding out in Brazil. When Sebastian becomes serious about his relationship with Alicia, the stakes get higher, and Devlin must watch her slip further undercover.

Strangers on a Train (1951):  In Alfred Hitchcock's adaptation of Patricia Highsmith's thriller, tennis star Guy Haines (Farley Granger) is enraged by his trampy wife's refusal to finalize their divorce so he can wed senator's daughter Anne (Ruth Roman). He strikes up a conversation with a stranger, Bruno Anthony (Robert Walker), and unwittingly sets in motion a deadly chain of events. Psychopathic Bruno kills Guy's wife, then urges Guy to reciprocate by killing Bruno's father. Meanwhile, Guy is murder suspect number one.

Dining follows the screening @ Charlie Brown's, 95 Linwood Ave, Township of Washington, NJ 07676, (201)[masked]
results.name: Face the Fiction:  Hitchcock Double Feature - Notorious  & Strangers on a Train

results.description:
Join us on Saturday, September 12, 2015 at 12 noon as we celebrate the National Day of Encouragement at Dosa Delight located at[masked]rd Street, Jackson Heights, New York 11372.

The National Day of Encouragement in the United States was announced in 2007 and occurs each year on September 12.

The Encouragement Foundation at Harding University in Searcy, Arkansas launched an effort to get Americans to participate in this Day of Encouragement. The first proclamation for the Day of Encouragement was made by Mayor Belinda LaForce of Searcy, Arkansas on August 22, 2007. In September Mike Beebe, the Governor of Arkansas, signed a proclamation making September 12, 2007 the "State Day of Encouragement" for Arkansas.

Later, President George W. Bush also signed a message making September 12 the official "National Day of Encouragement." The Encouragement Foundation is making plans to get more states involved in the National Day of Encouragement in the future.

You can join the Facebook Group for National Day of Encouragement here:

https://www.facebook.com/pages/National-Day-of-Encouragement/18928271732?fref=ts

The National Day of Encouragement is a day dedicated to uplifting those around us and making a positive impact, no matter the magnitude. It's that simple.

http://www.letsencourage.com/
results.name: National Day Of Encouragement Celebration

results.description:
Hello 3D Printing!

At this fun, interactive intro session, we'll explore the universe of 3D printing, including learning about 3D printers, 3D modeling, materials, printing services, the maker movement and much more. 

We'll have our 3D printers humming away so you can see these amazing machines in action. Sophia will also demo Morphi (www.morphiapp.com), a new 3D modeling app for iPad and iPad mini and discuss some basic techniques for making printable 3D models.

Bring your iPads and iPad minis or follow along as we use our devices.

Sophia Georgiou is founder and designer at The Inventery, Inc., a start-up that created Morphi, a 3D modeling and printing app for iPad/iPad mini, coming soon for Mac and Android. www.morphiapp.com In Morphi, people of all ages and skill levels can design 3D objects on the go using touch, without wifi or a mouse. The app can be used with or without a 3D printer. Morphi is an active part of the Maker Movement - having exhibited at World Maker Faire in New York, Maker Faire Rome, Capitol Hill Maker Faire, National Maker Faire, NY 3DPrint Design Show and Boston Fabfest with many more exhibitions to come. The app has been downloaded in 81 countries across 6 continents and is currently available for free download (with in app purchases) athttps://itunes.apple.com/us/app/morphi/id833530351?mt=8 Volume purchasing for schools, libraries and other institutions is available at https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/morphi-edu/id1003747185?mt=8

results.description:
Our book selection for September 12th will be: Eric Kandel's The Age of Insight: The Quest to Understand the Unconscious in Art, Mind, and Brain, from Vienna 1900 to the Present

Suggested chapters to read would be: Chapter 8 on Klimt, Chapter 9 on Kokoschka and Chapter 10 on Schiele.


A brilliant book by Nobel Prize winner Eric R. Kandel, The Age of Insight takes us to Vienna 1900, where leaders in science, medicine, and art began a revolution that changed forever how we think about the human mind—our conscious and unconscious thoughts and emotions—and how mind and brain relate to art. 
Gustav Klimt, Oscar Kokoschka, and Egon Schiele created startlingly evocative and honest portraits that expressed unconscious lust, desire, anxiety, and the fear of death. 
Kandel tells the story of how these pioneers—Freud, Schnitzler, Klimt, Kokoschka, and Schiele—inspired by the Vienna School of Medicine, in turn influenced the founders of the Vienna School of Art History to ask pivotal questions such as What does the viewer bring to a work of art? How does the beholder respond to it? These questions prompted new and ongoing discoveries in psychology and brain biology, leading to revelations about how we see and perceive, how we think and feel, and how we respond to and create works of art. Kandel, one of the leading scientific thinkers of our time, places these five innovators in the context of today’s cutting-edge science and gives us a new understanding of the modernist art of Klimt, Kokoschka, and Schiele, as well as the school of thought of Freud and Schnitzler. Reinvigorating the intellectual enquiry that began in Vienna 1900, The Age of Insight is a wonderfully written, superbly researched, and beautifully illustrated book that also provides a foundation for future work in neuroscience and the humanities. It is an extraordinary book from an international leader in neuroscience and intellectual history.
results.how_to_find_us: 2 blocks south of Union Square.  47 Fifth Avenue New York, NY 10003
results.name: The Age of Insight: Vienna 1900 to the Present

results.description:
** This class is for anyone who is completely new to improv and have been afraid to try it out. **

** You're welcome to stay and watch the Level 2 class that's happening right after this class ends. **

Public speaking is a powerful skill to have. And there is a powerful way to build upon and enhance your public speaking presence and have a good laugh at the same time: by learning how to improvise!

Improv takes focus, a willingness to embrace the group dynamic and a commitment to fostering your sense of play.

Dewey Chaffee, a professional comedian and improvisor, will lead you through each of these areas with skill, kindness and most importantly, patience, creating an environment that is safe, comfortable, and creatively inspiring.

Improv will make you a better listener, a more open and accepting communicator in life, and a master at slinging bullshit when you need to appear more confident than you feel on the inside!

More details here: http://makmlaff.wix.com/improvclasses

Anyone and everyone is welcome! 

-----------------------------------------------

About Dewey Chaffee

Dewey has more than 20 years of improvisation experience. He spent 23 years perfecting his skills as an improv performer for the Walt Disney Company. He's also appeared on Nickelodeon Television and worked as their audience warm up guy for several seasons of tv production.

Currently, he and his husband perform a live improvised comedy drag show, while at the same time, Dewey is taping his weekly MNN cable talk show, "The Midnight Kiki."

results.description:
1st Hour  

---30 min intro & chatter

• Let's get to know each other as we drift in. 

---30 min

(we didn't get to this last week) We'll discuss.

• What are your writing goals? You want to write something or you wouldn't be here. What do you want to write? 

• Write about where you want your writing to be 1 year from now.

• Do you write for money, passion or self esteem or something else?

• What's your motivation?

• Do you hope your writing will pay your bills? Or is writing for something else?


2nd hour 

We are talking about New York City and how we feel about life in Manhattan and the outer boroughs. 

• Are you new to the city? What are your impressions?

• Are you a lifer? For how long? What have you observed over your years?

• Are you here since "back in the day when..." ?

We'll discuss and do a writing prompt around this theme that we'll share and discuss some more.

3rd hour

It's all about you & your work. Bring something you long for feedback (no need to bring hardcopies for all, but it's helpful as hearing is sometimes an issue in certain venues. Another option is to post your work somewhere people with devices can access and read along).

Allot for 10 minutes worth of copy -- but if we have a big group (and it’s hard to know) prepare for your best 5 minutes (about 130 words per minute).

If we have a large group, we I'll break into smaller groups so everyone has a chance for adequate feedback time. 

Reading your work is optional; listening is not. Please respect people sharing their work and offer positive constructive feedback.  Be nice. Don’t be shy. Have fun! 

Our website is coming --  nywritingclub.com!

results.description:
We will have folks from outside of Meetup joining us on these tours, so it's almost always a nice sized group.

Our flagship tour of over 16 years. Greenwich Village is one of the most unique neighborhoods in the country. The number of writers, poets, playwrights, and songwriters that have lived, written and drunk here is staggering, and we've wrapped our tales together to create a fun and lively afternoon.

We'll hit several historic pubs with a rich literary history. While you relax over a drink you'll hear stories of the wild days of the neighborhood, the writer's who shaped the literary world, and we'll perform some of their work.

Rated as one of the best tours of New York City, unlike almost any other tour out there.

Tours are open to everyone.

Meetup members and their guests will get the discount price of $15 per person.

Hope to raise a glass and share a story with you. Either way, keep reading!
results.how_to_find_us: Come on in and look for the charming folks with a book and a beer!

results.description:
Welcome, new beginners!


Please take advantage of this chance to try this unique sport and meet some of the most friendly and encouraging people in New York City to fence with.

If there is no more space in this meetup, you can sign up for the 2pm-3pm hour at 


If you've never tried fencing before, we're happy to teach for the love of the sport.


If you're an experienced fencer, this would be a great time to invite some of your friends who have expressed an interest to check out the sport.


Please wear shoes with non marking soles and clothes that allow you to move freely.(There are changing rooms available)

There will be a brief demonstration, followed by some basic lessons and a chance to try your hand

The entrance to Battery Dance is at 380 Broadway near White St. near a sign that says "Empire Apparel"  ( https://www.google.com/maps/place/67+White+St,+New+York,+NY+10013/@40.7180128,-74.0039453,19.21z/data=!4m7!1m4!3m3!1s0x89c25a20812f2881:0x97720602ef7dd76c!2s67+White+St,+New+York,+NY+10013!3b1!3m1!1s0x89c25a20812f2881:0x97720602ef7dd76c?hl=en.. ) Ring the bell for the 5th floor and we'll buzz you up.

- Mike

results.description:
In the catacombs below the Vault of Swords dedicated to the god Tempus, your adventurers discover a new corruption sweeping through the Underdark. A deadly game fought in the arena of Hillsfar proves more than bloodsport - it serves as a dark ritual to feed a prince of the abyss. Only by working together with unexpected help can you thwart the rising madness, but can you trust drow agents as allies?

Although there is no cover charge for this event, because the venue is a bar/restaurant, players should factor in ordering brunch (see menu at http://www.lovecraftnyc.com plus drink specials on-site).

We're using 5th edition Dungeons & Dragons. You can download the basic rules (with 4 classes, 4 races) for free at http://bit.ly/1EzS3Uq -- new/returning players welcome, everything provided but bring dice if you got 'em.

DUNGEON MASTERS NEEDED FOR THIS EVENT! Last week saw 20 players show up for one DM, and although we split the group into half heroes, half bad guys, it wasn't the ideal D&D experience for players. If you can help run these events, we will provide you with the adventure and other support - reply in the comments here!

Sponsored by the UFC Gym Edgewater, Bergen/Hudson SWEATworking is happy to announce its first Self-Defense Seminar! 

Come join fellow professionals for a meet & greet followed by an intensive and instructional self-defense seminar. The seminar will feature a light cardio warm-up, boxing/kickboxing drills, and instruction of self-defense techniques for everyday situations.  No martial arts experience required or expected! The techniques you will learn are designed for all skill levels. 

The UFC Gym is located at 115 River Road in Edgewater NJ. Look for signs with the UFC Gym Logo! 

Bring your business cards and come prepared to meet local professionals while learning some fundamental self-defense principles!

results.description:
Open to ages 18+


SIGN UP AT PLAYERSLOUNGE.CO to choose which team pack you want!


Team Packages

Better teams come at a higher cost. Which ever package you choose, you must play with those teams for the entirety of the tournament.


$10 - 4 1/2 Star Teams

$20 - 5 Star Teams

$30 - Real Madrid


Event Location:


Nevada Smiths

100 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10003


Tournament Details:

Arrive at 1:30 PM. Event will end by approximately 5:30pm...if you make the finals that is.

World Cup Format - Group stage round robin, followed by the knock out stages.

Games will be played on eight Xbox Ones. 

Refund must be requested three days prior to event.


Tournament Structure:

Group Stage: Round Robin format. Groups will consist of four teams, each player plays everyone in the group once. The top two teams in each group move on to the knock out stage.     Win - 3 Points     Tie - 1 Point      Loss - 0 Points


Group Stage Tie Breakers:      

1. Goal Differential      2. Head to Head      3. Goals Scored      4. Goals Against       


Knock Out Stage: 

Single Elimination Tournament. The #1 seeds in each group will play the #2 seeds from another group.

Games will be played on eight Xbox Ones. If you have a Playstation 4 controller w/ a converter you are welcome to bring it.

Refunds must be requested one day prior to event.


Prizes:

1st Place - $100

2nd Place - $40

3rd Place - $20


Rules:

6 Minute Halves.


Legendary Difficulty.

Injuries Off.

Knock Out Stages: Overtime is played in classic. PKs at the end of extra time will not count. Games that are tied after 120 minutes will be restarted and played under a golden goal stipulation.

results.description:
Hey all. This month we're reading Station Eleven by Emily St. John Mandel. 

A National Book Award Finalist

A PEN/Faulkner Award Finalist 

Kirsten Raymonde will never forget the night Arthur Leander, the famous Hollywood actor, had a heart attack on stage during a production of King Lear. That was the night when a devastating flu pandemic arrived in the city, and within weeks, civilization as we know it came to an end. 

Twenty years later, Kirsten moves between the settlements of the altered world with a small troupe of actors and musicians. They call themselves The Traveling Symphony, and they have dedicated themselves to keeping the remnants of art and humanity alive. But when they arrive in St. Deborah by the Water, they encounter a violent prophet who will threaten the tiny band’s existence. And as the story takes off, moving back and forth in time, and vividly depicting life before and after the pandemic, the strange twist of fate that connects them all will be revealed.


We'll be meeting at the Skylight Diner to discuss the book and pick our next selection. Enjoy!

Link to our Facebook Group
results.how_to_find_us: We're in the back.
results.name: Station Eleven by Emily St. John Mandel

results.description:
Please check back after 8AM on the day of the event for a final update. 

If inclement weather is forecasted, expect to meetup in "Pax Wholesome Foods" (corner of 40th St./6th Ave).   Thank you. http://www.yelp.com/biz/pax-wholesome-foods-new-york-5 

If the weather is pleasant, expect to meetup at the table by the Bryant Park Fountain.  Look for the table with the blue/white checkered table cloth. 

*********************

Purpose:  Explore how one can discern who is a "good person?" 


What rules can we apply?  Under what context do these rules apply or apply?  What are the limits to the rules we develop?


Join us for food, drinks, and discussion.
Bring your collective wisdom.
--Greet old friends and meet new ones.

Monty Python's method!  How to tell who is a witch, haha.  :D

https://youtu.be/k3jt5ibfRzw

Proposed Agenda  

2:00 - Meetup at "Pax Wholesome Foods."  If the weather is pleasant, we will sit in Bryant Park by the Fountain.  Look for a table with a blue/white table cloth.  Form tables of 8-10.  Monique and Maria volunteered to moderate as well.

2:15   - Formal Introductions (1 min each)

          - Together work out rules and test them. 

3:45  - Final Comments

4:00 - Formal end.  Feel free to continue the conversation with the friends you've made, and switch to another table and meet ones.

(Note - Kindly arrive earlier if you wish to buy food or drinks from the local establishments.)

Suggestions

A. Listen to understand and suspend judgment. 

B. Make one point at a time and allow others to respond.  Speak from personal experience.

C. Listen for the underlying assumptions.  Look for new insights.

Note – Meetup.com nor the organizers neither screens participants, nor supervises or controls meetings, and we have no involvement with any of the individuals who participate. Therefore, we suggest that participants exercise good judgment when attending.

About the Moderator:  Yen is a parent, manager, and a former educator & examiner from the private and public sector.  Currently, the Yen is around $[masked] dollar.  :D
results.how_to_find_us: 2PM - Meetup at Pax Wholesome Foods.  If the weather is pleasant, we will sit in Bryant Park near the Fountain.
results.name: Conversation in Bryant Park - "How can one discern who is a 'good' person?"

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
